3d. They may in some places, both large and small, be removed by carts.
4th. They may be removed by lighters laid on shore, and loaded at low-water, and removed on tide of flood.
5th. They may be drawn over the rough ground by hand windlasses and tackles, to be moved from place to place as need shall require.
The stones may be laid hold of by eye-bolts fixed in hles bored with a jumper, Lewis fashion, or they may be harnessed with chains.

I would advise that the workmen at all times employ themselves upon those stones that lie lowest and nearest the channel, and as the flow of tides obliges them to retreat, to work upon those that lie higher.
I observe that a great many of the stones to be removed are very good lime-stones, which if broke up, I apprehend many would be glad to remove for the sake of the lime.

POSTSCRIPT.P: P. S. In coming down by way of South-Shields, I observed a place called the Mill-Dam, which, it the trade requires it, may be very properly converted into a wet dock, that would hold a great number of ships.

LETTER.HEAD: (Copied from the Trinity-House Books.)
LETTER.P: PURSUANT to the request of the right worshipful John Baker, Esq mayor, and of the corporation of Newcastle upon Tyne:

We the master, &c. of this house, having this day taken a survey of the rocks and loose stones, lying between the Low-Lights and Black-Middens, are of opinion, that taking up and removing the said rocks and stones, would be of the greatest advantage and utility to the navigation of the river Tyne, viz. where the rocks and stones now lie, there would be a bed of ouze and sand, consequently a fine bason and reservoir for the first influx of the stood-tide; and it is evident that ships or vessels will work in or out of the river Tyne with the greater safety.

The necessity of taking up and removing these rocks and stones is so obvious, and the practicableness thereof such as prevents us saying any more on that head, there∣fore annex Mr. Smeaton's opinion, which we hope will have its due weight.

N. B. From the point of the Low-Lights to the point of the Black-Middens is at or about 924 yards; and Great Prior, Little Prior, and Prior's Marrow-Stones, lie at about 300 yards distant from the bank-side.

AT the request of the mayor, and of the corporation, the master, &c. went down and surveyed the rocks and stones lying between the Low-Lights and Black-Middens. Mr. J. Smeaton accompanying the master. The two reports above-mentioned were drawn up, and ordered to be delivered to John Baker, Esq the present mayor.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 32. (No. 2.) A particular Case determined in the Court of King's Bench, on the Act, viz. 19 Geo. II. for the better Preservation of Rivers in England.
DIV2.P: A PERSON invented a machine or vessel, called a Hopper (and obtained a patent for it), to take ballast out of ships in rivers, in order to convey the same to the sea, and there drop it. The Hopper was so contrived, that the ballast. might be dropped from its bottom any where at pleasure, as opportunities offered, without being perceived by any, but those in the Hopper, or very near it.

This Hopper came into the river Tyne, and (besides the above objection), after trial, it was found to waste its ballast as it sailed, in such a degree, as to discolour the water where it passed; and being generally disapproved of, Alderman Smith, a justice of the peace at Newcastle upon Tyne (in order to put a stop to its being further used there), upon an information made to him, against one Brucklesbank, a shipmaster, for ballast being cast out of his ship into the Hopper, in order that such ballast might be dropt into the water, and not cast on the land where the tide never flows, summoned Bruck∣lesbank, and, on due proof, convicted and fined him according to the act: Bruckles∣bank, supported by the patentee, brought an action against the alderman for so doing, which was tried at Northumberland assizes, when the jury gave a special verdict, whereon the case was argued in the court of King's Bench, and decided as follows, viz.

M. 32. G. 2. Brucklesbank and Smith. On a special verdict from Northumberland assizes, it was stated, that the defendant, Mr. Smith, was a justice or the peace for the town and county of Newcastle upon Tyne; and that the plaintiff was master of a ship, floating in the river Tyne, being a navigable river; that three tons of ballast and more were unloaded out of the said ship, into a machine or vessel called a Hopper, in the said river, with intent that it should be carried therein into the high and open seas, and that it was accordingly carried out of the said river into the high and open seas, and was there cast out of the said Hopper, where the water was more than 14 fathom deep, at a distance from any port, haven, channel, or navigable river: whereupon the said Mr. Smith convicted the plaintiff as an offender against this act. And the plaintiff brought his action. It was urged, on behalf of the plaintiff, that this was no offence within the meaning of the act; that the mischief which the legislature had in view, was throwing the ballast or rubbish either on the shore, or the sides of rivers, and below the full sea-mark. But this was in the open and high sea, above 14 fathom deep, at a distance from any port, haven, channel, or river. By Lord Mansfield, Ch. J. This is a general question, which goes farther than this particular case: but it is a very plain and clear case, and expressly against the prohibition of the act; which provides, that it shall not be thrown but upon the land. Whereas this man says, that he has found a better way, than that which the act has expressly prescribed: but here is such an opening to fraud in this way, that he has thought a better one, that it would be danger∣ous to trust to this method, though it were not prohibited. However, it is enough, that it is contrary to the direct and express provision of the act. Indeed, if it was put into the Hopper, in order merely to carry it upon the land; that would only be the proper means of doing it, and therefore would not be an offence within the act: but this is with intent to lay it in the water; and there can be no security as to the place where the Hopper may drop it. It is mighty easy, from the construction of the Hopper, to drop it privately. And it is also the interest of the person who carries it in the
Hopper, to drop it as soon as he can; that he may come the sooner again to fetch more The shifting it out of one ship into another, without intention to drop it any where, would not be a case within the act: for that would not be a casting or throw∣ing out at all, within the meaning of the act. And judgment was given by the court, unanimously, for the defendant, the justice. Burrow, Mansfield. 656.

DIV2.HEAD: (HOSTMEN'S BOOKS.)
DIV2.P: IT was unanimously agreed by the fraternity of hostmen, to petition the parliament against Mr. Richard Liddell's patent for employing and using his machines for con∣veying of ballast out of ships in the river Tyne, and unloading them at sea; and a peti∣tion was accordingly prepared and read to the fraternity; and, at their request, the governor set his name, and affixed the common seal of the said fraternity thereto.

DIV2.HEAD: (HOSTMEN'S BOOKS.)

DATELINE.HI: At a Court of Hostmen, held

DIV2.P: IT appearing by the votes of the House of Commons of the fourth day of this instant February, that a petition of several owners and masters of ships employed in the coal-trade between London and Shields was presented to the house, setting forth (amongst other things) that from the present method of unloading ballast from ships, the river Tyne has of late years in many places become so shallow, and the river so apparently filling up, that the consequences are become greatly alarming, and praying the house to take the same into consideration: It is therefore unanimously agreed, and ordered accordingly, that a petition (of which the following is a true copy) be prepared, and that the governor be requested to sign the same, and also to affix the common seal of this fraternity thereto, and that the same be immediately after presented to the House of Commons.

DIV3.HEAD: To the Honourable the Commons of Great Britain in Parliament assembled. The humble Petition of the Governor, and Stewards, and Brethren of the Fraternity of Hostmen of the Town of Newcastle upon Tyne.
DIV3.P: THAT your petitioners observe by the votes of this honourable house of the 4th day of February instant, that a petition of the owners and masters of ships employed in the coal-trade between London and Shields, has been presented to this honourable house, containing allegations touching the harbour and river of Tyne, which your petitioners apprehend are not well founded.

That the preservation of the navigation of the river Tyne is of great consequence to your petitioners, and, as your petitioners humbly conceive, to this kingdom in general. That at the mouth of the river Tyne, there is a bar, and also a large bed of sand called the Herd; and, as your petitioners apprehend, the navigation of the said river may be in danger of being totally obstructed by a considerable increase of sand or ballast either upon the bar or Herd.

That your petitioners conceive the permitting of ballast to be unloaded from ships or vessels in the river Tyne, otherwise than to be cast or thrown upon the dry land where the tide or water never flows or runs, may be of dangerous consequence to the port and river of Newcastle: your petitioners, therefore, most humbly pray this honour∣able house to take the premises into consideration, and hope this honourable house will
not make any alteration in the laws now in force concerning the unloading of ballast in the said port or river of Newcastle upon Tyne.
And your petitioners, as in duty bound, shall ever pray.
In testimony whereof, we have caused the common seal of our fraternity to be here∣unto affixed, this 16th day of February, in the year of our Lord 1765.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 63. JARROW.
DIV2.P: THE large fragment of a Roman stone found at Jarrow, and inscribed, "Om∣nium Fil' Hadriani," &c. I suppose to have been part of an altar erected in honour of all the adopted sons of the Emperor Hadrian: taking this for granted, the word "omnium" must have been preceded by "pro salute." See an inscription on a stone found at the other extremity of the Roman wall, and now or lately at Boulness, in the county of Cumberland, and others.
Hadrian was over in person in Britain, A. D. 120.
Antoninus Pius, who succeeded him in the empire, was one of those adopted sons alluded to in the inscription.—Consult "Vita Hadriani—Script. Hist. August."

The other Roman stone, found in the same place, appears, like that at Tinmouth, to have been a tablet on the front of some temple, or other publick building, and acquires considerable importance from the circumstance of its containing the name of our island, Britannia, at full length. I suspect that the word "ostium" has followed "utrumque;" and that it perhaps may have been brought from the station of South Shields. The word ostium may, however, with the strictest propriety, be applied to the very spot where it was found. I shall hazard an explanation of this curious inscrip∣tion, at the same time leaving the learned, who are conversant in this species of anti∣quities and who may depend upon the faithfulness of the annexed representation, to judge for themselves.
I would supply the lacunae thus:
Diffusis provinciis in Britannia ad utrumque ostium exercitus posuit (or) sieri secit.
And translate it as follows:
"The army erected this on the extension of the Roman dominion in Britain from the western to the eastern sea."

N. B. I must observe in this place, that, as I set out with a resolution not to suppress any historical evidence, I could not but insert the returns of crimes found on the visi∣tation of Jarrow, Tinmouth monastery, &c. which I found in the Cotton Library; yet, I flatter myself I shall be thought to have done this, rather to shew what sort of pretences were made for suppressing the religious houses at the Reformation, than either because I believed the facts myself, or wished to incline others to what I fear would be generally considered as a very uncharitable species of credulity.

Item in Hertenesse inter duas aquas 20s.
Item de finibus, releviis et aliis casualibus comuniter estim' 32s.—Summa 24li. 10s 5d.
Summa omnium bonorum temporalium precedent' 9xxli. 16s. 6d. ob. q.—Decima 19li. 12s. ob. qa.
Ista summa non concordat cum rotulo taxator'. Nam in rotulo eorum sic dicitur: Prior de Tynemuth habet annuatim in bonis temporalibus ad valorem 200li.—Decima 20li.

DIV3.HEAD: (Tinmouth Chartulary, fol. 56.) Taxacio omnium Bonorum spiritualium.
DIV3.P: TAXACIO decimarum ecclesie de Tynemuth s'u vicaria.
De villa de Tynemuth 13 marc' De Whitelei 9 mare'.

De Seton Mon' 13 marc' De Erdesdon 12 marc' De Preston 8 marc' De tribus Chirtons 13 mace' et dim' De Milneton et Shcles 5s. De duabus Bacworth 40s. De Sighal 11 marc' De Haliwell 8 marc' et di' De Neusum 4 marc' De North Seton 18 marc' De Hertelawe 18 marc' De molendinis 5 marc' De lana et agnis 69s. De aucis et porcell' 5s. 6d. De feno et lino 40s. De cerag' 40s. De baptister' et pur' 20s. De mortuar' & pannis defunctorum vend' 70s. De annuis oblationibus 6l. 10s. De minutis rebus propter conscientiam 40s.—Summa 111lib. 12s. 10d. de quibus dedu∣cuntur 40li. viz. pro elemosinis liberaliter factis 30li. et pro pitanciis monachorum 10li. Et sic remanet de claro 71li. 12s. 10d. Un' decima 7li. 3s. 3d. ob.
De decimis & pensionibus ad dictam ecclesiam aliunde pertinentibus.
De Elstewyke 12 marc' De Wylom 70s. De Wolour 4li. De Bothal 20s.
De Herteborn pro pensione 8li. De Wodehorn pro pensione 4l. 18s. 3d.—Summa 29li. 8s. 3d. Decima 7li. 10s. 2d.
Taxatio decimarum ecclesie de Wodehorn s'u vicaria.

De Wodehorn 25 marc' De Seton 24 marc' De Widerington 12 marc' De Haiden 5 marc' De Chibburn 40s. De Linem' et Hirst 100s. De Ellington 13 marc' De molend' ejusdem ville 15s. De Dririgge 40s. De Creswell 13 marc' De Linton 6 marc'—Summa 75li. 20d. Decima 7li. 10s. 2d.
Taxatio decimarum de Horton.
De Horton 20 marc' De Copoun 8 marc' De Bebeset 40s. Summa 20li. 13s. 4d. Decima 41s. 4d.
Summa total' decimarum precedentium allocat' 20li. pro elem'et pitanc' 9xx 16li. 16s. 1d.
Decime de Ellewyk et Oveton inter duas aquas. Taxantur ad 25 marc. Decim' 2 marc' & di'—Summa omnium bonorum spiritualium precedent' 200l. 13l. 9s. 5d.
Porciones sacriste de quibus decima dari debet & sunt superius nominate.

De pensione de Whalton 1 marc' De annuis oblationibus 110s. De mortuariis et pannis defunctorum vend' 45s. De bapt' & pur 20s. De lino 20s. De pensione de Herteborn 4l. De decimis de Wylom 30s. De decimis de Wollour 4li. De decimis de Dnem' et Hirst 100s. De decimis de Rubor 4li. De Mothouses 6s. 8d.— Summa 29li. 5s. Decima 58s. 6d.

Porciones camerarii de quibus decima dari debet et sunt superius De decima de ......100s. De pentione de Wodhorn 4li. 18s. De pensione de Herborn 4li. De deci∣ma de Bohal 20s. De West Chirton 11li.—Summa 26li. 18s. 3d. Decim' 7s. 9d. ob
De terris fuis dimissis ad firm' 40s. preter reddit' suum.
Et est sciend' quod sacrista et camerarius respondent priori pro porcionibus suis et prior ulterius pro tota decima.
Summa tocius decime prestande pro omnibus bonis spiritualibus 21li. 8s. 3d. ob.
Summa socius decime prestande pro omnibus bonis temporalibus 20li.
Summa decime utriusque videlicet bonorum spiritual' et temporalium 41li. 8s. 3d. ob.
umma unius denar' de qualibet marca predicta 51s. 9d. ob.

DIV3.HEAD: (Tinmouth Chartulary at Northumberland-House, fol. 1.) Rentale de Tynemuth factum anno Domini 1378.
DIV3.P: CONSUETUDINES et opera que homines de Tynemuth facere debent et ab an∣tiquo consueverunt facere.

Omnes de Tynemuth qui terras tenent semel in anno arabunt ad cibum prioris cum aratris suis et illud herciabunt ad cibum suum proprium. Omnes illi qui terras tenent et tofta tres precar' facient in antumpno cum uno homine tantum et quartam precar' cum tota familia sua preter hospitissam ad quam quatuor jurati ejusdem ville erunt mes∣sores. Omnes selfodes facient quilibet tres precar' tantum. Omnes quindecim tenentes facient quilibet unum inlade sine cibo et garb' viz. de campo de Tynemuth ubicunque fuerint assignati per cellerarium Unusquisque eorum unam carect' car' de Seton de la Vale et habebunt cibum & garbam preter ulryg, qui cum alio socio faciet cariag' ut supra∣dictum est.

Homines de Tynemuth custodient prisones et si evenerit aliqua evasio solvent pro qua∣libet evasione 8li. sterling Et illi qui sedent super ten' capital' voc' XV. habebunt communiam pasture tempore aperto preter in tempore warrecti nullus habebit commu∣niam in le howes inter Northwell howes et le Somer Immo omnibus anni temporibus est seperale prioris.

Item prior potest facere sibi quoddam seperale pro voluntate sua tempore aperto tam de terr' tenentium suorum ville de Tynemuth quam de suis infra quod seperale nullus predicte ville communicabit nisi cum averiis suis cum quibus facit le boner et vadit ad aratra sua. Et in omnibus aliis locis preter clausturam et preter le midhope & le howes predicti 15 tenentes habebunt communiam pasture tempore aperto ad omnia averia sua exceptis porcis ad quos nullus habebit communiam aliquo tempore anni. Item unus∣quisque cotarius ville de Tynemuth habebit comuniam cum animalibus suis in com∣muni mora, videlicet in Schiremore omnibus temporibus anni et non alibi. Et omnia loca vasta voc' Balkes sive pastur' sunt seperale solum prioris. Nec aliquis tenens ten' ex terr' vel ten' sinc terr' potest alienare vel dare aliquam partem sue tenure fine fine faciend' in eur' dicti prioris. Et si heres sanguine debet habere ingressum in heredita∣tem suam dabit relevium vel duplicabit firmam suam in ingressu suo et saciet sidelitatem et sect' curie de tribus septimanis in tres septimanas. Et omnes tenentes de Tynmuth cum contigerit solvent layrewyt pro siliabus vel ancillis suis, et eciam merchet pro siliabus suis maritand' preter Dominum Philippum de Marston qui liberatus est de illo servicio.

Nec aliquis eorem potest cariare aliquod bladum in autumpno priusquam prior cari∣averit vel inciperit cariare et hoc secundum cursum per quem prior cariaverit Et sol∣vent pro effus' sanguinis fi contigerit 8s. Quilibet braciator sive pistor sive carnisex amerciabitur ter in anno propter assisam fract' Et quilibet braciator dabit tolnet' de cerevisia sua priusquam aliquam vendat videlicet de qualibet bracina 2 lag' et 1 quartam
de meliore cerevisio et 2 lag. et 1 quart' debilioris cerevisie et molere debent ad 13 vasselum Et in adventu primo novi abbatis Sancti Albani ad Tynemuth dabunt XV tenentes 40s. sterling voc' Welcom Abbatis.

DIV3.HEAD: (Tinmouth Chartulary, fol. 68.) Modus faciendi le conveyes apud Whiteleye.
DIV3.P: MODUS faciendi servicium quod dicitur le conveyes apud Whiteley videlicet quod omnes homines de prioratu de Tynemuth omnes equi et omnes canes ejusdem prioratus et omnes prehendinantes in dicto prioratu ac omnes servientes prioris apud manerium de Preston et serviens messor et carectarius cum uno equo de manerio de Seton et omnes servientes in bargia qui dicuntur Kelers et quatuor trituratores et ventilator vel ventilatrix venient quolibet anno ad natale Domini in festo Sanctorum Innocencium apud Whiteley citra villam de Whiteley Et ibi dominus ejusdem ville eis obviabit et eos congrue et honorabiliter recipiet et eis in predicto festo Innocentium & in crastino per illos duos dies et duas noctes inveniet omnia necessaria ita quod congrue sint hospitati et pasti videlicet quod omnes homines predicti serviantur de duobus cursi∣bus congruis et sufficientibus et caseo ad nonam et tota libera familia similiter de duobus cursibus & caseo ad cenam Ac etiam quod armigeri et pares sui servientur in diebus car∣nium de integris gallinis pro secundo cursu ad cenam Scilicet inter duos una gallina et duo de minori statu semper de medietate galline cum carnibus recentibus atiatis pro secundo cursu ad coenam servientur Et omnes bubulci et pares sui de grossis carnibus et caseo ad cenam servientur Ira quod omnes tam liberi quam bubulci bonam habeant cerevisiam et congruam Et quod semper duo habeant unum lectum sufficientem et statibus eorundem competentem Et quilibet equorum habebit bonum foragium ex∣ceptis pallfridis prioris qui de feno vel pisis loco feni retroactis temporibus serviebantur & recepti fuerint et hospitati infra manerum de Whiteley Et quilibet equorum habebit dimidiam bollam bone avene Et si quid superfuerit de eadem prebend' per custodem granarii ad granarium prioratus cariabitur de quibus serviciis Dominus Simon de Wal∣den quondam prior de Tynemuth predecessor domini prioris nunc fuit seisitus per ma∣nus Johannis de Whiteley quondam domini de eadem qui omnes predictos servientes una cum pallfridis et omnibus aliis equis de stablo dicti prioris in domo sua recepit hos∣pitabatur et pascebat ac omnia alia necessaria eis et omnibus equis et canibus sufficienter et honorabiliter invenit Tamen per aliam vicem ad instantiam dicti Johannis omnes bubulci & garciones ac alicqui equi et canes tunc senescallo dicti prioris Johanne de Budden hoc gratiose permittente hospitati et procurati fuerunt ad domos tenentium pres fati Johannis de Whirtley in Whiteley.

DIV3.HEAD: Cokshotes de Wylom.
DIV3.P: Conecessu est Waltero filio Ricardi tenere illud Cokshot quod Johannes de Wylom prius tenuit in orientali boseo de Wylom a die Mercurii prox' post festum Sancti Larcae Evang' anno regni Regis E. tercii a conquestu 13. usque eundem diem anno revoluto redd' inde domino priori to gallos silvestres. Concessum est Rogero Marke tenere per idem tempus illud Cokshot quod idem Rogerus prius tenuit in predicto bosco redd' 8 gallos silvestres. Concessum est Ricaido sil' Willielmi tenere per idem tempus illud Cokshot quod Willielmus prius tenuit in predicto bosco redd' 6 gallos silvestres.—Sum∣ma 24 gallos.

N. B. A learned friend, to whose opinion I pay a very great regard, has suggester to me, that there must have been another line at the top, on the Roman tablet dis∣covered
at Tinmouth (of which an explanation is hazarded, p. 65), to the following purport:
"Port' excav' in"
Gyrum, cumbas,
et templum &c."

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 185. (From the Murray MS. Page 61.) 30 August, 31st Elizabeth.
DIV2.P:
ELIZABETH Dei gratia Anglie Francie et Hibernie Regina Fidei Defensor &c. omnibus ad quos presentes littere pervenerint salutem. Cum nos per literas nos∣tras patentes sub magno sigillo nostro Anglie consect' geren' dat' apud Westm' quinto die Februar' anno regni nostri vicesimo quarto dederimus et concesserimus dilecto con∣siliario nostro Carolo Domino Howard de Essingham officium magni admiralli Anglie Hibernie Wallie et dominiorum et insularum eorundem ville Calesiae ac marchiarum ejusdem Normannie Gasconie et Aquitanie una cum omnibus jurisdictionibus authori∣tatibus libertatibus officiis preeminenciis et privelegiis quibuscunque eidem officio spec∣tantibus et pertinen' habend' gaudend' et occupand' officium pred' eidem Carolo pro termino vite sue una cum omnibus & singulis premissis ac rebus aliis quibuscunque eidem officio pertinen' prout per easdem litteras patentes inter alia plenius liquet Cum∣que etiam major & burgen' ville Novi Castri super Tynam in com' ville Novi Castri super Tynam et predecessores sui vigore cart' celebris memorie Domini Henrici Sexti quondam Regis Anglie eis ad emendacionem status ville pred' concesse diversus liber∣tatibus privelegiis & immunitatibus jurisdictionem marinam et admirallinam concernen' infra villam pred' et portum ejusdem et precinct' eorundem hactenus usi & gavisi sue∣runt dictique major & burgen' ville pred' nobis jam humillime supplicaverunt quatenus nos eorum authoritat' et jurisdictionem rebus marinis & admirallin' amplior' privelegiit exemptionibus libertatibus et immunitatibus augere locupletare et ampliare et stabi∣lire cosque jam variis nominibus appellat' in unum certum et stabile nomen incorpora∣tionis redigere et creare velimus. Sciatis qupd nos considerantes bona laudabilia et gratuita servitia que pred' major' et burgen' ville pred' et predecessores siti nobis in cliteque memorie et recordacionis progenitor' nostris nuper regibus Anglie diversis mod' impenderunt de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris con∣cessimus ac pro nobis hered' & successor' nostris per presentes ordinamus & constitu∣mus quod villa nostra Novi Castri super Tynam predict' sit et permaneat imposterum imperpetuum libera villa per se et quod burgenses & inhabitantes ejusdem ville de cetero imperpetuum sint et erunt unum corpus corporatum et politicum in re sacto et nomine per nomen majoris & burgensium vill' Novi Castri super Tynam in com' ville Novi Castri super Tynam et eos per nomen majoris et burgensium ville Novi Castri super Tynam in com' ville Novi Castri super Tynam unum corpus corporatum et politicum realiter et ad plenum pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris erigimus sacimus or∣dinamus & creamus per presentes et quod per idem nomen habeant successionem per∣petuam et sint et erunt perpetuis futuris temporibus persone habiles et in lege capaces
ad habend' perquirend' recipiend' & possidend' terras tenementa libertats jurisdictiones franchesias & hereditamenta quecunque cujuscunque gereris nature sive speciei fuerint sbi er successor' suis in feod' et perpetuitate necnon ad dand' concedend' dimittend' et assignand' eadem terras tenementa et hereditamenta et ad omnia et singula alia sacta & res faciend' et exequend' per nomen pred' et quod per idem nomen placitare possint of implacitari respondere et responderi defendere et defendi valcant & possint in qui∣buscunque curii placeis et locis et coram quibuscunque judicibus et justiciar' et aliis personis et officiariis nostris quibuscunque hered' et successor' nostrorum in omnibus & singulis actionibus sectis materiis causis querelis et demand' quibuscunque cujuscun∣que sint generis nature conditionis seu specici eisdem modo et forma prout alii legii hujus regni nostri Anglie persone habiles et in lege capaces placitere & impla∣cita respondere et responderi defendere et defendi ac habere perquirere recipere possi∣dere dare concedere ac dimittere valeant et possint Et quod dicti major & burg' pro tempore existen' habeant commune sigillum pro causis et negotiis suis quibuscunque et successor' suorum agend' serviturum ac quod bene liceat & licebit eisdem majori & burgen' et successoribus suis sigillum illud ad libitum suum de tempore in temous fran∣gere mutare et de novo facere prout eis melius videbitur expedire Et de ampliore gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris volumus ac pro nobis hered' & success' nostris damus & concedimus per presentes prefat' majori burgne' et success' suis quod ipsi tantum villam pred' cum suis membris & pertinen' ac etiam omnes easdem consuetudines libertates privelegia & franchesias immunitates exemptiones quietan' et jurisdictiones quot et quantas sibi aut predecessoribus suis per chartas nostras seu ali∣quorum progenitorum nostrorum antehac concesse fuere necnon omnia & singula eadem & hujusmodi consuetudines libertates privelegia franchesias immunitat' quiet' exemp∣tiones & jurisdictiones que probi homines ville de Novo Castello super Tynam et que burgen' de Novo Castro super Tynam et que burgen' et probi homines ville Novi Castri super Tynam et que communitat' ville Novi Castri super Tynam et que major & burgenses ville de Novo Castro super Tynam aut eorum aliquis vel aliqui per quecun∣que nomina sive quodcunque nomen vel per quamcunque incorporacionem vel pre∣textu cujuscunque corporationis antehac habuer' tenuer' usi vel gavisi fuer' aut habere tenereuti vel gaudere debuer' habuit tenuit usus vel gavison fuit sive debuit ratione sive pretextu aliquar' cartar' aut litterar' patentim per nos velper aliquem progenitor' uron regum hujus regni Anglie quoquomodo antehac fact' confirmat' vel con∣cessur' seu quocunque allo legali modo jure & consuetudme usugresiptione sive antehac usitat' habit' seu consuer' habend' tenend' et gandec' predictam a∣omnia ac singula predict' consuerudines libertat' privelegia ex∣emptiones quiet' jurisdictiones & ceterae omnia et singula premissa prefat' major' et burgen' ville pred' et successor' suisad um & bge' et successor' suor' imperpetuum tenend' de nobis firma reddend' inde nobis hered' et successoribus nostris antiquam cen∣tum librar' solvend' nobis hered' & successor' nostris annuatim ad festum Sancti Archangeli tantum pro omnibus aliis servitiis exactionibus et demand' nobis nered' et successor' nostris proinde reddend' solvend' seu Et de ube∣nore gratia nostra volumus ac per presentess pro nobis hered' e successor' nostris conci∣us presat' major' & burgen' ville predict' et eorum successoribus quod et burgenses ville pred' pro tempore existen' vel major pars eorundem pariter congregat' et assemblar' habebuntas per presentes habeant plenam auctoritatem protestatem et alt' condendi con∣sttuendi ordinandi faciend' et stabiliendi de tempore in tempus hujusmodi leges instju ordinaciones & constitutiones que major et burgen' ville pred' sive predict' major ville predict' et majori parti burgen' ejusdem ville bona salubria til honesta et necessar
juxta eorum snas discretiones fore videbuntur pro bonis regimine & gubernatione ma∣joris & burgen' ville pred' ac omnium aliorum inhabitantium ejusdem villc ac omnium mercatorum officiarior' ministror' artificum et residen' quorumcunque ville predict' pro tempore existen' ac pro declaratione quo modo et ordine major et burgen' et ceteri omnes & singuli ministri officiarii et artifices inhabitantes & residentes ville illius et eorum factores servien' et apprent' in officiis function' minister' artific' et negotiis suis infra villam predict' ac libertatem ejusdem pro tempore existen' sese habebunt gerent et utentur ac aliter pro ulteriori bono publico communi utilitate et bono regimine ville predicte ac victualacionem ejusdem ville ac etiam pro meliore preservacione gu∣bernacione locacione & dimissione terrarum tenementorum possessionum revencion' et hereditamentorum prefat' major' & burgen' et successor' suis dat' commiss' sive assignat' aut imposterum concedend' dand' vel assignand' ac res et causas alias quascumque vil∣lam pred' aut stat' jura et interesse ejusdem ville tangen' sive quoquomodo concernen' Quodque major & burgens' et commune consilium ville predicte pro tempore existen' vel predict' major et major pars predict' burgen' ville predicte quotiescunque hujus∣modi leges instituta jura ordinaciones et constitutiones condiderunt fecerunt ordinave∣runt vel stabilierunt in forma predicta hujusmodi et tales penas punitiones penalitates & imprisonamenta corporis vel per fines et amerciamenta vel per eorum utrumque erga et super omnes delinquentes contra hujusmodi leges institut' jur' ordinaciones et con∣stitutiones sive eorum aliquod vel aliquam qualia et que eisdem major' & burgen' et communi consilio pro tempore existen' sive pred' major' et majori parti burgen' ville pred' necessar' et requisit' pro observacione pred' legum ordinacionum et constitutio∣num melius fore videbitur facere ordinare limitare & providere ac eadem fines et amer∣ciamenta per discretiones seu alio modo quocunque levare ac habere et retinere possint et valeant sibi et successor' suis ad usum pred' vill' absque calumpnia vel impediment' nostri aut hered' vel successor' nostror' aut alicujus officiarior' vel ministror' nostrorum aut hered' vel successorum nostrorum que omnia et singula leges ordinationes constitu∣tiones jura et institut' si cut prefertur faciend' observari volumus sub penis in eisdem con∣tent' Ita tamen quod leges ordinaciones institutiones & constitutiones hujusmodi non sint repugnant' aut contraria legibus aut statutis hujus regni nostri Anglie. Et volumus ac pro nobis hered' & successor' nostris ordinamus ac concedimus per presentes quod dicta villa Novi Castri super Tynam ac circuit' precinct' & jurisdict' inde de cetero sint et se ex∣tendant et protendant ac extendere et protendere valeant et possint per limit' et ward' ville predicte tam in longitudine et latitudine quam in circuit' et precinct' ad talia et con∣simil' ac hujusmodi bund' et metas et limit' tam per terram quam per aquam ad quales et quas et prout predicta villa Novi Castri super Tynam ac circuit' precinctus ac jurisdic∣tio inde a tempore cujus contrar' memoria hominum non existit se extendere et proten∣dere consueverunt. Et in rivolo de Tyne a quodam loco vocat' le Sparhawke in mari usque le Hedwine-Streames Et quod bene liceat et licebit prefat' majori et burgen' ville pre∣dicte et successor' suis perambulacionem et perambulationes inde facere pro libertatibus et franchesiis super vidend' cognoscend' et limitand' circa infra et extra villam pred' et precinct' ejusdem in quibuscunque locis terris tenementis aquis sive dominiis fuerint sive intra eandem villam sive in com' Northumbr' sine impedimento nostri hered' vel successor' nostror' seu aliorum quorumcunquq prout per quadrat' metas bund' limit' venell' stall' lemi' lampad' petras muros sepes aquas pontes fossas fossat' domos, parietes, cruce, vel aliter quocunque modo limitantur sicut praeantea usi fuerant a etiam omnes hujusmodi sepes muros fossas fossat' stall' domos parietes ac omnia alia quecunque clausur' in hujusmodi perambulatione facien' si sibi viderit expedire, deponere rumpere frangere icludere et libere parva sine impedimento nostri hered' vel successor' nostror' vel alicujus alterius inire pertiansire et exire et ea omnia et
singula ita permittere et sinere sine aliqua satisfactione seu recommendatione prout ante∣hac usi fuerint et hoc totiens quotiens eis placuerit seu eis necessar' fore videbitur et hoc absque aliquo brevi sive alio warrant' proinde a nobis hered' vel successoribus nostris in hac parte quoquomodo impetrand' seu prosequend' Et ulterius de uberiori gratia ac ex certa scientia e mero motu nostris perdonavinus remisimus et relaxavimus ac pro nobis hered' et successor' nostris per presentes perdonamus remittimus & relaxa∣mus prefat' major' burgen' ville Novi Castri super Tynam predict' et successoribus fuis omnes et omni nod' execution' perqusit' et retentiones dominiorum terrarum et tenementor' rectorir' decimar' redditum revencionum seu aliorum hereditament' quorumcunque per dict' maj' et burgen' seu predecessor' suos vel eorum aliquem vel aliquos de nobis vel aliquibu progenitor' seu predacessor' nostrorum aut de quibus∣cunque subditis nostris vel quocunque subdito nostro aut prefat' progenitor' vel pre∣decessor' nostrorum fact' contra foncam et effectum statut' de terris & tenementis ad manum mortuam non ponend' seu alterius statuti actus seu ordinacionis cujuscunque prohiben' alienacione terare et tenementor' hominibus religiosis seu corporibus poli∣ticis fiend' Nec non tot' jus tuculm et interesse nostra intrandi ingrediend' et retinend' dominia maneria terras et heredramenta sic ut prefertur empta et perquisita nobis ra∣tione alienacionis eorundem prefat' major' et burgen' seu aliquibus predecessoribus suis absque licentia nostra fact' accret' et obtent' Volentes ac pro nobis hered' & successor' nostris per presentes concedentes dict' major' et burgen' ville pred' et successoribus suis quod ipsi et successores sui habeant teneant et gaudeant deinceps imperpetuum omnibus & singulis eisdem dominiis maneriis terris tenementis et hereditamentis sic ut prefertur emptis et perquisitis contra formam eorundem statutorum vel eorum alicujus absque impetitione seu molestatione nostri hered' vel successor' nostrorum aut aliorum officiari∣orum nostrorum hered' vel successorum nostrorum quorumcunque Cumque quod∣dam vetus et ruinosum castrum scituat' existit' infra pred' villam nostram Novi Castri super Tynam sed in com' nostro Northumbr' extra libertates ejusdem ville ratione cujus multe & diverse persone nequissime ibidem commorantes qui licet infra villam pred' impune evadere nullo modo permittuntur, ipsi tamen fugientes in castrum pred' mul∣toties punitiones meritas evadunt Qui quidem major et alii officiarii ville pred' nullam habeant libertatem seu auctoritatem hujusmodi malefactores in castrum pred' seu clau∣sum precinct' ambit' et circuit' ejusdem castri fugam seu evasionem sacientes artachi∣andi acrestand' apprehendend' licet vetus castrum illud et clausus circuitus pre∣cinctus et ambitus ejusdem castri ad nullum alium usum conducant quam pro pri∣sona seu communi gaola pro com' nostro Northumbr' pred' ac pro communi aula vocat' The Muthall seu aula session' ejusdem comitat' Sciatis igitur quod nos de gratia nostra speciale ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris dedimus et concessimus ac pro nobis hered' et successor' nostris pro consideratione pred' per presentes damus & con∣cedimus prest' major' et burgen' ville predicte et successoribus suis quod ipsi et suc∣cessores sui imperpetuum habeant et habere possint et valeant plenam libertatem & auctoritatem de tempore in tempus intrand' in clausus castri predicti ac in dom' et manho' quascunque infra ambit' circuit' et precinct' ejusdem castri (except' tantum∣modo gaola nostra ibidem vulgariter vocat' The Dungeon) ac infra clausum domos et mausion' pred' exercend' faciend' gaudend' tota tanta talia cadem hujusmodi et con∣similia authoritat' libertates jurisdictiones preeminenc' et libertat' quecunque in at∣tachiand' arrestand' corrigend' et puniend' omnes et omnimod' hujusmodi malefactores et personas ibidem seu infra clausum castri pred' domos et mansion' pred' de tempore in tempus commorantes inhabitantes et existen' nec non in committend' eosdem male∣factores gaole ville predicte et eosdem ibidem detinend' quo quant' et qual' authoritat' libertat' jurisdiction' preeminenc' presat' major et burgen' ville predicte antchac exer∣cuerunt habuerunt vel gavisi fuerut aut exercere habere vel gaudere debuerunt in at∣tachiand'
arrestand' corrigend' puniend' et committend' malefactores quoscunque infra villam Novi Castri pred' et libertates ejusdem commoran' inhabitan' et existen' Et ulterius de uberiore gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia ac mero motu nostris pro nobis hered' & successor' nostris damus et concedimus per presentes presat' major' et bur∣gens' Novi Castri super Tynam pred' et successor' imperpetuum quod eadem villa et portus ejusdem ville necnon omina et singula loca infra precinct' et libertates ville et portus pred' tam per terram quam per aquam a tempore quo predict officium magni admiralli nostre Anglie per mortem forisfactur' aut sursum redditionem inde seu alio modo quocunque primo et proximo vacare contigerit tantummodo quoad hujusmodi causas inferius mencionat' unde predict' major et burgen' per presentes habent maritimam sive admirallinam jurisdictionem sint et erunt exempt' separat' distinct' as absolut' imperpetuum a quacunque potestate jurisdictione et officio admiralli et ad∣mirallorum regni nostri Anglie et successor' nostrorum ac corum commissarior' officiarior' deput'et surrogator' locum tenentium et ministror' suorum pro tempore existen' et eandem villam et portum ejusdem necnon omnia & singula loca infra precinct' et libertat' ville et portus pred' tam per terram quam per aquam ac omnes et singulos inhabitantes' commorant' & residen' infra limites et precinct' ville et portus pred' ac omnia bona et catalla et res suas tam reales quam personales infra vill' et port' pred' existen' sive exitur' imposterum a tempore quo pred' officium magni admiralli Anglie per mortem sursum redditionem seu alio modo quocunque primo et proxim' vacare contigerit per∣petuis futuris temporibus quoad hujusmodi causas inferius mentionat' unde pred' major et burgen' per presentes habeant maritimam et admirallinam jurisdictionem a potestate jurisdictione de officio pred' pro nobis hered' & successoribus nostris tantummodo separamus absolvimus sejungimus et distinguimus per presentes Et preterea concedi∣mus presat' major' & burgen' ville pred' et successor' suis per presentes quod ipsi e successores sui a tempore quo pred' offic' magni admiralli Anglie per mortem foris∣fact' sursum reddic' aut alio modo quocunque primo et proxim' vacare contigerit im∣perpetuum habeant et teneant ac habere et tenere possint et valeant infra villam pred' unam cur' admiralitat' de record' quolibet die Lune in qualibet septimana per annum vel quando et quoties eis visum fuerit coram majore recordatore et aldermannis ejus∣dem ville pro tempore existen' vel tribus aut pluribus eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus et quod major recordator et aldermanni ville pred' pro tempore existen' tres vel plures eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus a tempore quo predict' offic' magni admiralli Anglie per mort' forisfactur' sursum reddition' aut alio quoquomodo primo et proxim' vacare contigerit habeant jurisdictionem sacultatem & authoritatem tenere per querel' in dicta cur' levand' omnia et omnimod' placita lect' querel' et demand' de quibuscunque debit' contractibus conventionibus transgress' deceptionibus rebus et offensis quibuscunque cur' admiralitat' pertinen' sive in eadem cur' determinabil' ac infra precinct' ville predicte aut port' vel libertat' ejusdem ville emergen' sive acciden' una cum eorum emergen' dependen' inciden' annex' et connex' juxta leges & consuctud' cur' admiralitatis nostre Anglie alisque legal' viis et modis quibus veritas melius sciri poterit coram eisdem majore recordator' et aldermann' tribus vel pluribus eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus audiend' discutiend' et temi∣nand' ita quod tamen' una pars ad tunc sit commorans aut inhabitans infra vill' aut port' pred' vel precinct' eorundem ac personas quascunque in ea parte prout casus exigit coram dict' major' recordator' et aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' tribus vel pluribus eorum quorum presatum majorem unum esse volumus comparete et respondere cum cujussibet coercionis temporal' ac cum suis alternis penis vel mulct' potestat' juxta leges et consuctud' cur' admiralitat' nostre Anglie compelland aut judicium faciend' et ministrand' juris' ordine servato seu velo levato summarie et de
plano sine strepitu & figura judicii sola fact' et rei veritat' inspect' procedend' eisdem modo et forma prout in dicta cur' admiralitat' Anglie usitat' est aut sieri potest aut debet. Et ulterius de uberiori gratia nostra er ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris assigna∣vimus constituimus et fecimus ac pro nobis et successor' nostris assignamus constituimus ordinamus et concedimus pe presentes prefat' major' et burgen' vill' pred' et successor' suis quod major recordator et aldermanni ville pred' pro tempore existen' tres vel plures eorum quorum prefat' major' unum esse volumus sint et erunt de cetero imper∣petuum justic' et officiar' nostri hered' ac successor' nostror' ac plenam potestatem et authoritatem habeant et habebunt ad pacem nostram infra port' ac vill' predict' ac limit' et precinct' eorundem conservand' et conservari faciend' infra villam pred' et port' pred' ac limit' eorundem quoad hoc quod ad jurisdictionem admiralli pertinet faciend' statut' et ordinaciones apud Westm' anno regni Domini Edwardi tertii quondam Regis Anglie vicesimo septimo de forstallar' mercandizarum super aquam vel mare ac statut' de retibus exclusis, molendinis stankis stakis et bidellis in disturbacionem passagii et distructionem piscium in et super grossis rivis et fluminibus public' occupat' et erect' in parliamento Domini Edwardi primi quondam Regis Anglie anno regni sui tertio decimo et Domini Edwardi tertii anno regni sui quadragesimo quinto ac in parliamento Domini Richardi secundi annis regni sui tertio decimo et decimo septimo ac in par∣liamento Domini Henrici quarti anno regni sui primo ac in parliamento Domini Henrici sexti nuper Regis Anglie pro retibus & ingeniis in rivo Thamesis et aliis rivis dicti regni nostri Anglie anno regni sui secundo apud Westm' tent' edit' ac statut' apud Westm' anno tricesimo quarto Domini nuper Regis Henrici octavi pro preser∣vatione rivorum rodarum et portuum hujus regni Anglie atque statut' apud Westm' contra regrator' forestallor' & ingrossator' annis quinto et sexto Domini Edwardi sexti nuper Regis Anglie fratris nostri precharissimi tent' edit' et provis' ac statut' preser∣vationis seminis seu spermae piscium in dicto parliamento nostro anno regni nostri primo eciam edit' ac statut' edit' anno tertio decimo Edwardi primi pro positione rivorum in defenso et preservatione salmonum ac statut' edit' decimo septimo Richardi secundi pro preservatione salmonum et retibus et ad inquirend' plenius veritat' de om∣nibus & singulis hujusmodi malefactoribus et aliis delinquentibus quibuscunque infra villam et portum pred' et limit' eorundem contra pacem nostram seu contra leges, et statut' predict' Ac de omnibus aliis articulis et circumstanciis quibuscunque eadem premissa quovis modo concernen' ac infra vill' sive portum pred' sive libertat' aut pre∣cinct' eorundem acciden' sive emergen' ac que ad curiam admiralitat' pertinent in∣quirend' velque in eadem cur' inquiri possunt vel debent Necnon ad hujusmodi in∣dictamenta et presentationes quecunque de tempore in tempus coram majore recorda∣tore & aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' tribus vel pluribus eorum quorum prefatum majorem vel recordatorem unum esse volumus in cur' admiralitatis ville pre∣dicte presentat' et compert' inspiciend' audiend' et terminand' tam ad sectam nostram quam aliorum quorumcunque eisdem modo et forma prout in alia' admiralitat' aut coram quibuscumque commissionar' nostris pro rebus maritimis legitimo usitat' est et fieri consuevit. Et quod servien' ad clavam ville predicte pro tempore existen' sive eorum aliquis vel aliqui omn' jurat' pannell' inquisitiones attachiamenta precept' mandat' warran' judicia sententias processus et alia quecunque necessar' faciend' causas pred' et alias causas dict' vill' et portum ac libertat' et precinct' eorundem tangen' seu concernen' eisdem modo et forma prout in consimilibus casibus usitat' est seu fieri debeat in aliqua cur' admiralitatis in aliqua civitate villa burgo vel loco infra hoc regnum nostrum Anglie Et ulterius dedimus et concessimus ac pro nobis hered'et successoribus nostris per presentes damus et concedimus presat' major' et burgen' ville predicte et successoribus suis pro meliore executione omnium & singularum ordinaci∣onum et constitutionum nostrum pred' quod major ville pred' pro tempore existen'
habeat et habebit de cetero imperpetuum plenam authoritatem et potestatem quoties opus et necesse fuerit ad nominand' preficiend' ordinand' assignand' faciend' et consti∣tuend' judicem sive judices commissar' sive commissarios assisten' sive assistentes registrar' vel registrarios et omnes et omnimod' alios officiarios et ministros accessarios idoneos et oportunos causis et negotiis pred' in cur' pred' tractand' agend' et terminand' diri∣gend' gubernand' recordator' irrotuland' registrand' et expediend' vice et nominibus predict' major' recordator' et aldermann' ville predicte pro tempore existen' deputand' et assignand' ac ad omnia et singula premissa vice et nominibus eorundem major' recordator' et aldermann' faciend' et exequend' necnon hujusmodi officiar' et ministros et eorum quemlibet al' hujusmodi officiis et exercitio eorundem juxta juris et equitatis exigentiam amovere et expellere ac alium vel alios eorum loco sive locis modo pre∣miss' ad eorum bene placitum sustinere et ordinare possint et valeant quoties magis ex∣pediens videbitur Et quod prefatus major recordator et aldermann' ville predicte pro tempore existen' tres vel plures eorum quorum prefat' major' unum esse volumus habeant imperpetuum cognitionem omnium et singulorum hujusmodi placitorum sectarum querelarum et demand' debitorum conventionum deceptionum negotiorum maritimorum et aliarum causarum et offen' pred' que ad jurisdictionem admirali∣tatis pertinent infra villam et port' pred' vel precinct' aut libertat' ejusdem fact' perpetrat' sive contingen' Ita quod una pars adtunc sit commorans sive inhabitans infra villam seu portum pred' sive libertat' vel precinct' eorundem necnon cogni∣tionem et decisionem de wrecco maris magno seu parvo infra villam predictam sive port' pred' ac precinct' eorundem acciden' ac de morte submercione et visu corporum mortuorum quarumcunque personarum infra villam et port' pred' qualitercunque inter∣fect' aut submersar' aut interficiend' vel submergend' murderat' sive murderand' aut aliquo alio modo ibidem ad mortem devenien' ac etiam custod' et conservationem statutorum nostrorum de wrecco maris et officio coronator' annis tertio et quarto Edwardi primi edit' et provis' et quacunque causa infra vill' sive port' pred' vel precinct' eorundem acciden' et cognitionem de hujusmodi mahemio in eisdem locis contingen' quoad jurisdictionem admiralitatis pertinet cum potestate etiam puniendi delinquentes in ea parte quotiescunque juxta juris exigen' ac cur' nostre admiralitat' consuetud' et eadem placita sect' querel' et demand' secundum legem regni nostri Anglie hered' et successor' nostrorum audiant et terminent ac audire et terminare de tempore in tempus possint et valeant absque impetitione molestatione impedimento calumpnia seu grava∣mine nostri hered' vel successor' nostror' seu aliquorum admirallorum nostrorum hered' vel successorum nostrorum seu eorum alicujus aut eorum alicujus locum tenen' com∣missionar' officiar' ministr' seu deputat' suorum pro tempore existen' Et quod major ville pred' pro tempore existen' imperpetuum habeat et habebit potestatem et auctori∣tatem recipiendi cognitiones quascunque pro quacunque causa admiral' in cur' admiral' ejusdem ville ut prefertur determinabil' et easdem recognitiones in cur' predicta re∣cordand' et inrotuland' et easdem ad libitum suum secundum legem relaxand' cancel∣land' minuend' er qualificand' necnon execution' demandand' juxta morem et consuc∣tud' cur' admiral' nostrae Anglie et pront in ejusmodi casibus usitatum est Et ulterius de uberiore gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris damus et concedi∣mus per presentes prefat' major' et burgen' ville pred' et successoribus suis omnia et singula fines redemptiones exitus amerciamenta forisfact' perquisit' et proficua que∣cunque coram major' recordator' & aldermannis ville predicte pro tempore existen' tribus vel pluribus eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus in cur' admiralitat' pred' emergen' contingen' provenien' assiss' imposit' seu taxat' vel im∣posterum assidend' imponend' seu taxand' ac omnes alias sorisfact' ex aliqua alia causa quacunque pred' cur' admiralitat' pred' tangen' seu ad eandem pertinen' forisfact' et forisfaciend' ubi una pars pro tempore est commorans residens seu inhabitans infra vil∣lam
& portum pred' vel precinct' eorundem habend' tenend' levand' et colligend' eisdem majori & burgen' ville pred' et successor' suis per se vel per deputat' suum sufficient' aut deputat' suos sufficientes ad eorum proprium opus et usum et in melior' support' ville et portus pred' absque compot' seu aliquo alio proinde nobis hered' vel successoribus nostris quovis modo reddendo useu solvend' seu faciend' Et quod bene liceat et licebit eisdem majori & burgen' & successoribus suis imperpetuum omnia eadem amerciament' fines redempciones exit' et forisfactur' immediate cum adjudicat' fuerint per se vel per ministros suos de tempore in tempus seisire capere colligere et levare imperpetuum absque impedimento molestatione inquietacione vexatione seu per∣turbacione nostri hered' vel successor' nostrorum aut justic' admirall' vicecomit' escaetor' ballivorum aut aliorum officiar' ministror' seu subditor' nostrorum heredum seu successorum nostrorum quorumcunque Concessimus insuper ac pro nobis hered' et successor' nostris per presentes concedimus prefat' major' et burgen' ville pred' et successor' suis quod iidem major et burgen' et successor' sui a tempore quo pred' of∣ficium magni admiralli Anglie per mortem sursum reddicionem seu alio modo quo∣cunque prim' et proxim' vacare contigerit habeant infra villam et portum pred' ac libertat' circuit' et precinct' eorundem de cetero imperpetuum omnia et omnimod' hujus∣modi bona et catalla waviat' wrecca maris flotzon jetzon lagonshares thesaur' in∣vent' sive inveniend' felon' de se deodand' et alias casualitat' tam insuper vel per mare littorave vel per partes maritimas quam insuper vel per aquas dulces seu portus flumin' vel loca mundan' infra fluxum et refluxum maris seu alibi infra libertat' precinct' et circuit' ville sive portus pred' qualitercunque quandocunque vel quomodo∣cunque emergen' contingen' seu provenien' que ad admirall' Anglie pertinent habend' vel concessum est habere necnon omnes & omnimod' pisces regales viz. sturgeons balenas cecas porposias delphinos riggos et graspecias ac omnes alios pisces quoscunque magna sive ingen' crassitudine sive pinguid' in se habentes infra vill' sive port' pred' sive precinct' & limit' eorundem acciden' et ab antiquo de jure vel consuetudine pertinen' aut spectan' aut aliquo alio modo consuet' Volumus insuper ac pro nobis hered' et suc∣cess' no.stris concedimus prefat' majori et burgen' et successoribus suis quod admirall' Anglie extunc deinceps ad officium admirall' Anglie evehend' et promovend' et eorum quilibet vel ejus aut eorum locum tenens commissar' officiar' surrogat' procurator vel deputat' aut locum tenentes commissar' officiar' surrogat' procuratores vel deputati pro tempore existen' villa' libertat' port' precinct' ac alia loca per terram vel aquam ad aliquod inibi quod ad offic' admirall' pertinet seu pertinere poterat faciend' seu exer∣cend' et que per partes prefat' major' et burgen' conceduntur aliqualiter non ingrediatur seu ingrediantur aut se inde infra vill' port' libertat' aut precinct' alicujus eorundem aliqualiter intromittat seu intromittant Dantes autem hujusmodi admirallo et admirallis nostris hered' et successor' nostrorum extunc ad officium admirall' Anglie per nos hered' aut successores nostros evehend' et promovend' aut eorum locum tenen' com∣missar' officiar' surrogat' procurator' et ministris aut eorum cuilibet tenore presentium firmiter in mandatis quod ipsi et corum quilibet sub sola exhibitione seu demonstratione presentium omnibus et singulis premissis pareant et obediant absque aliquo brevi seu aliquo alio processu seu mandato in hac parte eis dirigend' et prosequend' seu obtinend' in futur' ea in aliquo non contraveniend' Volumus etiam ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus et successobribus nostris concedimus prefat' major' et burgen' ville pred' et successor' suis quod major recordator et aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' tres vel plures eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus de tempore in tempus imperpetuum in futur' sint justic' nostri hered' et successorum nos∣trorum ad gaolam ville pred' de prison' in ea existen' eidem gaol' quacunque causa committend' de tempore in tempus deliberand' et quod coronator ville pred' pro tem∣pore
existen' omnia jurat' inquisitiones pannell' attachiamenta et indentur' per ipsum capt' et imposterum capiend' coram prefat' major' recordator' et aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' tribus vel pluribus eorum quorum prefat' major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus cum et quoties gaola illa de prisonibus in ea existen' deliberare voluerint de tempore in tempus facient retorn' ac eis in omnibus deliberationibus gaole pred' tangen' sint attendent' et precept' eorum major' recordatoris et aldermann' pro tempore existen' trium vel plurium eorum quorum major' vel recordator' unum esse volumus exequantur de tempore in tempus eisdem modo et forma prout aliquis vice∣comes regni nostri Anglie coram justic' ad gaolas in aliquibus com' dicti regni nostri hered' et successorum nostrorum deliberand' facere retornare intendere vel exequi quovis modo per leges hujus regni nostri Anglie consuevit Quodque iidem major recordator et aldermanni et successores sui habeant et habebunt et erigere de cetero poterint furcas infra libertates ville pred' ad felon' murderator' et alios malefactor' infra villam pred' secundum legem Anglie adjudicat' suspendend' et quod pred' major recor∣dator et aldermanni ville pred' pro tempore existen' quoscunque felones latrones et alios malefactores infra villam & portum pred' vel precinct' et libertat' eorundem invent' per se aut per ministros aut deputat' suos in vill' pred' deputatos constitutos capere et ar∣restare ac eos usque gaolam infra villam pred' ducere possint ibi salvo custodiend' quous∣que per debitum legis processum deliberentur Et ulterius de uberiore gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris concessimus et licentiam dedimus ac pro nobis hered' et successoribus nostris per presentes concedimus et licentiam damus quibus∣cunque subditis nostris necnon cuicunque subdito nostro ac hered' et successor' nos∣trorum quod ipsi maneria messuagia terras tenementa rectorias decimas redditus reverciones servitia et al' possessiones revenciones et hereditamenta quecunque que de nobis hered' vel successor' nostris immediate non tenentur in capite vel per servitium militare necnon de nobis seu de aliquo alio five aliquibus aliis per servitium militare absque speciali licentia nostra hered' seu successorum nostrorum aut fine licentia domini vel dominorum de quo vel de quibus pred' terr' tenementa et heredita∣menta tenentur dummodo eadem maner' messuag' terr' tenementa rector' decimis red∣dit' reverciones et servicia seu al' possessiones reventiones et hereditamenta pred' non excedant annuum valorem ducentarum marcarum per annum dare concedere alienare feoffare et assignare possint et valeant majori et burgen' ville pred' pro tempore existen' quod ipsi maner' messuag' terr' tenementa rectorias decimas reddit' rever∣ciones servicia ac alia possession' revencion' vel hereditamenta que de nobis hered' vel successor' nostris immediate non tenentur in capite nec per servitium militare nec de nobis seu de aliquo alio five aliquibus aliis per servitium militare absque speciali licentia nostri hered' vel successor' nostrorum sine licentia domini vel dominorum de quo vel de quibus pred' terr' & hereditamenta tenentur dummodo eadem maner' messuagia terr' tenement' rector' decime reddit' reverciones et servicia seu alia pos∣sessiones revenciones & hereditamenta predicta non excedant clarum annuum valorem ducentarum marcarum per annum de quibuscunque subditis nostris aut de quocunque subdito nostro ac hered' vel successor' nostrorum aut de aliis personis quibuscunque vel de aliqua persona quacunque habere recipere perquirere et tenere possint et valeant sibi et successor' suis imperpetuum similiter licentiam dedimus ac pro nobis hered' et successoribus nostris per presentes damus specialem statut' de terr' & tenementis ad manum mortuam non ponend' aut aliquo alio statuto actu ordinacione piovisione seu restrictione in contrar' antchac habit' fact' edit' ordinat' seu provis' aliqua alia re causa vel materia quacunque in aliquo non obstante Volumus etiam ac per presentes pro nobis hered' et successor' nostris concedimus presat' majori et burgen' quod habeant et habebunt has literas nostras patentes sub magno figillo nostro Anglie debit' modo fact.' cefigillat' absque sine seu seodo magno vel parvo nobis in Hanaperio nostro seu alibi ad
usum nostrum proinde reddend' solvend' seu faciend' Eo quod expressa mentio de vero valore annuo aut de certitudine premissorum sive eorum alicujus aut de aliis donis seu concessionibus per nos seu per aliquem progenitorum nostrorum prefat' majori et burgen' ville pred' ante hec tempora fact' in presentibus minime fact' existit aut aliquo statuto actu ordinacione provisione seu restrictione inde in contrar' fact' edit' ordinat' seu provis' aut aliqua alia re causa vel materia quacunque in aliquo non, obstante. In cujus rei testimonium has literas nostras fieri fecimus patentes Teste meipsa. apud Westmonaster' tricesimo die Augusti anno regni nostri tricesimo primo. POWLE.

CLOSER.SIGNED: Per breve de privato sigillo. Examinatur per Willielmum Brencke."

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 186.
DIV2.P: Great Charter, 22d March, 42d of Queen Elizabeth.
In an Inspeximus Patent, 1a. pars paten' de anno R. R. Car. IIdi. 16o.
From Grey's MSS. who has subjoined the following note in the margin:
"This charter cost the corporation 635l. 10s. which money was sent up to Mr. Rush-worth, then the town's agent."

REX omnibus ad quos &c. salutem. Inspeximus litteras patentes incliti predeces∣soris nostri Domine Eliz. nuper Regine Angl' de concessionibus majori & burgen∣sibus ville Novi Castri super Tinam et successoribus suis fact' in hec verba: Elizabeth Dei gratia Anglie Francie et Hibernie Regina Fidei Defensor &c. omnibus ad quos pre∣sentes litere pervenerint salutem. Cum villa Novi Castri super Tinam sit antiqua villa & comitatus per se, cumque major & burgenses ville predicte habuerunt tenuerunt et gavisi fuerunt diversa jura jurisdictiones libertates franchesias quietanc' privelegia et diversas alias libertates ac immunitates exempciones et jurisdictiones tam per prescrip∣tionem quam pretextu diversarum cartarum concessionum et confirmationum tam per nos quam per diversos progenitores nostros Reges Anglie concess' cumque villa pre∣dicta dampna non modica passa est ob diversas discordias lites contentiones inter bur∣genses ville predicte exortas et motas racione defectus aliquarum dictarum literarum paten' de libertatibus predict' confectar' ac ratione et pro & concernen' modum onera∣tionis & exonerationis carbonum fossilium Anglice sea-coles & lapidum infra villam pred' et portum Novi Castri super Tinam super que major & burgenses ville predicte nobis humilline supplicaverunt ut nos pro melioracione ville & com' predict' et pro gubernatione et prestantiore regimine ejusdem et pro meliori sustentacione & suppor∣tacione grandium onerum sumpt' et expensar' quod ipsi pro manutencione ejusdem ville de tempore in tempus sustinent ac indies magis magisque sustinere et sustentari verisimiliter videntur munificentiam et gratiam nostram regiam gratiose exhibere et ex∣tendere dignaremur, nos itaque eorum petition' in hac parte gratiose annuentes & inclinantes ac ampliori gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris volumus
ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus et successoribus nostris damus et concedimus pre∣fat' majori & burgensibus et successoribus suis quod ipsi tantum villam predict' cum fuis membris et pertinen' ac etiam omnes easdem consuetud' libertat' pnveleg' franches' immunitat' exempciones quietancias & jurisdictiones quot et quantum sibi aut predeces∣soribus suis per cartas nostras seu aliquorum
