cetero imperpetuum unus discretus & probus homo de dicto numero de le hoastmen ville Novi Castri super Tinam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tinam qui annuatim quarto die Januarii eligetur nominabitur & preficiet per dictos fratres fraternitatis illius vel majorem partem eorundem fore et esse guber∣natorem fraternitatis pred' & tunc et ibidem sacramentum prestet corporale ad dictum officium gubernatoris debite exequendum in officio illorum remansi' pro uno anno integro tunc proxime sequenti si tamdiu vixerit Et quod similiter sint et erunt de cetero imperpetuum duo honesti & discreti homines de dicto numero de le hostmen ville Novi Castri super Tinam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tinam qui annuatim dicto quarto die Januarii eligentur nominabuntur & preficientur per dictos gubernatores senescallos & fratres fraternitatis pred' vel majorem partem corundem fore et esse senes∣callos fraternitatis pred' et tunc et ibidem quilibet eorum similiter sacramentum pres∣tabit corporale ad dictum officium suum seneschalli debite exequend' quolibet eorum in officio suo remansur' pro uno anno integro tunc proxime sequenti si tam diu vixerit Et pro meliore executione presencium et quod voluntas nostra in premissis prestabili∣orem habeat et sortiatur effectum assignavimus nominavimus constituimus et creavi∣mus et per presentes pro nobis hered' & successoribus nostris assignamus nominamus constituimus & creamus dilectum subditum nostrum Willielmum Jennison sen' fore primum & modernum gubernatorem fraternitat' pred' volentes dictum Willielmum Jennison in dicto officio gubernatoris illius remansur' et quod sit & remaneat in eodem officio a dat' presentium usque dictum quartum diem Januarii prox' futur' et a dicto quarto die Januarii quousque aliquis alius fraternitatis illius ad dictum officium guber∣natoris fraternitatis pred' debite electus prefectus et juratus sit (si dictus Willielmus Jennison tam diu vivere contigerit) Insuper assignavimus nominavimus constitimus & appunctuavimus ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus & successoib nostros assigna∣mus nominamus & appunctuamus dilectos subditos nostros Franciscus Anderson & Johannem Barker esse primos et modernos seneschallos illius vle ditos seneschallos in dicto officio seneschallor' remoratur' et quod quilibet sit et re∣acat in eodem officio a dato presentium usque dictum , Januarii proximo' futurum et a dicto quarto die Januarii quousque alius aut alii fraternitati illius as dic∣tum officium seneschallorum fraternitatis pred' debite et presei & ati sit et nt si dicti Franciscus Anderson et Johannes Barker aut aliqui diu vivere contigerit Volumus etiam et per preentes coedimu pro ibus & succes∣soribus nostris quod si contigerit gubernatorem fraternitatis pro tempore existen' infra ann' proxim' post quam ad officium gubernatoris sic ut prefertur eletus & prefectus fuerit obire decedere aut ob rationabilem causam remover aut deponi ab officio gubernatoris pred' quod tunc et de tempore in tempus et toties proties casus sic acciderit dicti seneschalli et fratres fraternitatis illius pro tempore existen' major numer' eorundem habeant et habebunt per presentes plenm potestatem & authorita∣tem unum alium discretum & honestum virum seipsis igeni nominandi & presi∣ndi fore et esse gubernatorem dicte fraternitatis qui quidem sic electus nominatus & prefectus ad officium pred' habeat & exerceat officium illud pro residuo anni illius extn venturi (corporali suo sacramento prius prestitu de officio illo debite exequend') Et contigerit dictos seneschallos fraternitatis illius aut eorum aliquem pro tempore existen' obite decedere aut ob rationabilem causam ab officio suo deponi aut amoveri qud tunc etiam de tempore in tempus et toties quoties casus sic acciderit dicti guber∣nator & fratres fraternitatis illius pro tempore existen' aut major pars eorundem similiter habeant et habebunt per presentes plenam potestatem & authoritatem unum alium ut alios honestos & discretos viros de seipsis eligendi nominandi & prefiiendi
fore et esse seneschallum aut seneschallos dicte fraternitatis loco vel locis hujusmodi sic obeuntis decedentis depositi aut amoti obeuntium decedentium depositorum aut amo∣torum qui officium illud exerceat aut exerceant pro residuo anni illius extunc venturi (corporali suo sacramento sive sacramentis prius prestitis de officio illo debite exe∣quend') Volumus insuper & pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris damus & con∣cedimus per presentes dictis gubernatori seneschallis & fratribus fraternitatis de le hostmen ville Novi Castri super Tynam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tynam & successoribus suis quod dicti gubernator seneschalli & fratres dicte fraternitatis de le hostmen ville Novi Castri super Tinam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tynam & successores sui (quorum gubernatorem fraternitatis illius et dictos seneschallos tres esse volumus aut dictum gubernatorem & unum dictorum seneschallor' duos esse volumos) habeant & habebunt omni tempore opportuno de cetero imperpetuum plenam potesta∣tem & authoritatem se congregandi & conveniendi in guildhalda sua aut in aliquo alio loco convenienti infra villam pred' et ibidem constituendi ordinandi & stabiliendi de tempore in tempus hujusmodi leges instituta jura ordinaciones & constitutiones que dictis gubernatori senescallis & fratribus fraternitatis illius aut majori parti eorundem (quorum dictos gubernatorem & seneschallos tres esse volumus aut dictum guberna∣torem et unum seneschallorum pred' duos esse volumus) bona salubria utilia honesta & necessaria juxta eorum sanas discretiones fore videbuntur pro bono regimine et guber∣nacione gubernatoris seneschallorum et fratrum fraternitatis pred' et pro declaratione quo modo et ordine dict' gubernator seneschalli et eorum factores servientes & ap∣prenticii in officiis & negotiis suis dictam fraternitatem concernentibus sese habebunt gerent & utentur ac aliter pro ulteriori bono publico dictor' gubernatoris seneschallorum & fratrum fraternitatis illius quodque gubernator seneschalli & fratres fraternitatis illius quorum dictum gubernatorem & seneschallos tres esse volumus aut dictum guberna∣torem et unum seneschallor' pred' duos esse volumus quotiescunque hujusmodi leges instituta jura ordinaciones & constituciones condiderint fecerint ordinaverint vel stabi∣lierint in forma pred' hujusmodi et tales penas puniciones penalitates et imprisonamenta corporis vel per sines & amerciamenta vel per eorum utrumque erga et super omnes delinquentes contra hujusmodi leges instituta jura ordinaciones et constitutiones sive eorum aliquod vel alique imponere possint et valeant qualia et que eisdem gubernatori seneschallis et fratribus dicte fraternitatis vel majori parti eorundem (quorum dictum gubernatorem & seneschallos tres esse volumus aut dictum gubernatorem et unum seneschallorum dictorum duos esse volumus) necessaria et requisita pro observatione predictarum legum ordinacionem & constituionum melius previdebitur facere ordinare limitare et providere ac eadem sines & amerciamenta per discretiones suas seu alio modo quocunque levare ac habere et retinere possint et valeant sibi et successoribus suis ad usum gubernatoris seneschallorum et fratrum fraternitatis pred' absque calumpnia vel impedimento nostri vel heredum vel successorum nostrorum aut alicujus aut aliorum officiarior' vel ministror' nostrorum aut heredum seu successorum nostrorum que omnia & singula leges ordinaciones et constitutiones jura et instituta sic ut prefertur faciend' observari volumus sub penis in eisdem contentis ita tamen quod leges ordinaciones in∣stitutiones & constitutiones hujusmodi non sint repugnantes aut contrarie legibus aut statutis hujus regni nostri Anglie Ulterius volumus ac pro nobis heredibus & succes∣soribus nostris damus & concedimus dictis gubernatori seneschallis & fratribus fraterni∣tatis de le hostmen ville Novi Castri super Tinam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tinam & successoribus suis quod de cetero imperpetuum dicti gubernator & seneschalli & fratres dicte fraternitatis & successores sui vel major pars eorundem (quorum guber∣natorem & seneschallos predictos tres esse volumus vel dictum gubernatorem & unum seneschallor' predictor' duos esse volumus) habeant et habebunt plenam potestatem & authoritatem de tempore in tempus ad libitum suum eligendi nominandi et ordinandi
alios dicte ville inhabitantes & burgenses ville Novi Castri super Tinam pred' esse et fore fratres fraternitatis pred' (fuciamen' corporal' prius prestito per quemlibet hujus∣modi sic electum & nominatum de ordinacionibus & statutis diete fraternitatis servand') qui quidem sic electus nominatus & juratus electi nominati & jurati fratres fraternitatis illius erunt nominabuntur et existent Insuper ex gratia nostra speciali certa scientia et mero motu nostris dedimus et concessimus ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris damus & concedimus licentiam potestatem et authoritatem per presentes dictis gubernatori seneschallis & fratribus fraternitatis de le hostmen ville Novi Castri super Tinam in comitatu ville Novi Castri super Tinam et successoribus fuis quod gubernator seneschalli & fratres dicte fraternitatis pro tempore existen' et eorum successores et eorum quilibet de cetero imperpetuum possint et valeant quite et pacifice habere tenere uti et gaudere omnibus talibus et hujusmodi libertatibus prive∣legiis immunitatibus jurisdictionibus usibus et consuetudinibus et eorum quilibet pro et concernen' oneracione exoneracione carcatione & discarcatione carbonum fossilium Anglice stone-coles pitt-coles et lapidum Anglice vocat' grindstones rubstones and whet∣stones et quod possint et valeant et quilibet eorum possit et valeat de cetero imperpe∣tuum onerare et exonerare carcare et discarcare in vel ex aliquibus navibus navigiis vel vasibus carbones fossiles et lapides pred' infra predictum rivum et portum de Tyne in aliquo loco sive locis prout illis melius videbitur expedire in aliquo loco vel aliquibus locis inter dictam villam Novi Castri et supradictum locum in dicto rivo existentem vocat' ye Sparhawke adeo prope dictam villam Novi Castri super Tinam prout con∣venienter fieri possint secundum veram intentionem nostram in hiis presentibus superius expressam prout homines & fratres dicte fraternitatis aliquo tempore usi fuerunt aut confueverunt non obstante slatuto in parliamento Domini Henrici octavi precharissimi patris nostri incepto apud London tertio die Novembris anno regni sui vicesimo primo et abinde adjornato ad Westm' in comitat Midd' tento edito intitulato Acius concernens Novum Castrum super Tinam & portum & sinum eidem spectan' aut aliquo alio actu ordinacione proclamatione & restrictione in contrarium non obstante Volumus etiam et per presentes concedimus prefatis majori & burgensibus quod habeant et habebunt has literas nostras patentes sub magno sigillo nostro Anglie debito modo facias & sigillatas absque fine seu feodo magno vel parvo nobis in Hanapetio nostro seu alibi ad usum nostrum proinde quoquomodo reddendo solvendo vel faciendo eo quod expressa mentio de vero valore annuo aut de certitudine premissorum sive eorum alicujus aut de ilus donis sive concessionibus per nos seu per aliquem progenirorum nostrorum prefatis majori et burgensibus ville pred' ante hec tempora factis in presentibus minime facta existit aut aliquo statuto actu ordinacione provone seu resttione in contrarium inde ante hec habita fact' edita ordinata seu prov aliqua as vl mria qua∣cunque in aliquo non obstante In cujus retestnium ha litera no fie fim patentes Teste meipsa apud Westm' vicesimo secundo die Mari anno regni nostr qua∣dragesimo secundo.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 189. The Great Charter of the 2d of James I. From an Inspeximus of the 16th Year of the Reign of Charles II. 2 Pars pat'. (From Grey's MSS.)
DIV2.P:
INSPEXIMUS etiam litteras patentes precharissimi avi Domini Jacobi nuper Regis Anglie (beate memorie) de aliis concessionibus prefatis majori et burge libus ville Novi Castri super Tinam pred' et successoribus suis fact' in hec vera: Jacobus Dei gratia Anglie Scotie Francie et Hibernie Rex Fidei Defensor &c. omni∣bus ad quos presentes littere pervenerint salutem. Cum quedam questiones contro∣versie et variancie nuper orte et mote fuerunt inter majorem aldermannos et commune concilium ville nostre Novi Castri super Tinam ac gubernatorem seneschallos & fratres fraternitatis de le hostmen ejusdem ville Novi Castri super Tinam et quosdam bur∣genses ejusdem ville ex una parte et diversos alios comburgenses ejusdem ville ex altera parte precipue pro et concernen' formam et ordinem electionis major' recordator' et aliorum officiarior' annuatim eligibil' infra eandem villam ac concernen' confeccionem concession' et factor' sub communi sigillo ejusdem ville et concernen' dispositinem bonor' catallor' reddit' et revencion' ville pred' ac concernen' diversas lites et contro∣versias inter majorem & burgens' ejusdem ville et pred' corpus incorporat' de le host∣men ejusdem ville Nos volentes quod deinceps omnes pred' questiones controversie & variancie penitus tollantur ac amicabilis et vera pax concordia et justitia sint cuique tribuens inter eosdem in dies magis magisque nutriatur et crescat ut eo liberius et quietius tam in debit' servitiis nostrorum heredum & successorum nostrorum peragend' quam suis propriis et honestis comodis & emolumentis intendere possint de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris voluimus ordinavimus constituin & concessimus ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris volumus ordi∣namus constituimus & concedimus dictis majori & burgensibus ville Novi Castri super Tinam & successoribus suis quod electio et electiones majoris recordatoris & alder∣mannor' vicecom' communis consilii et omnium & singul' aliorum officiar' sive minis∣tror' eligibil' ejusdem ville sive com' Novi Castri super Tinam pro tempore ex' habeantur celebren perficiantur et fiant modo et forma sequen' et non aliter saliqu concessione ordinacione constitutione decreto usu prescriptione consuetudine aut aliqua alia e causa seu materia quacunque non obstante) videlicet quolibet anno die prov' post festum Sancti Michaelis probi homines & burgense de duodecim societat' sive mister' in villa pred' licite possint et valeant in loco consueto infra villam pred' convenire & congregare slicet mercator' panni lanei Anglice drapers mereer' Angli' mercers pellipar' Anglice skinners scissor' Anglice taylors mercator' blad' Anglice merchants of corn alias dict' boothmen pistores Anglice bakers tanuator' Angli tanners alutarii Anglice cordwainers sellarii Anglice sadlers lanii Anglice buh. tab feri' Anglice smiths et fullon' Anglice sullers et quod in eisdem loo et homines cujuslibet diet' mister' burgens' ville pred' nominabunt et presentabu pro burgense de quolibet mister' suo infra villam predictam commoran' bitan' coram majore et aldermannis ville pred' pro tempore existen' qui quidem
homines ex mister' ill' sic nominat' et presentat' de numero vigint' et quatuor existen' scilicet de quolibet misterio duos burgenses tunc et ibidem coram dictis majore et aldermannis ville pred pro tempore existen' super sacrosancta Dei Evangelia jurabunt quod ipsi vel major pars eorundem antequam ab invice decesserint tunc et ibidem super consultatione ac comunicatione inter eos prius habit' elgerint nominaverint eligent aut nominabunt secundum sanas discretiones suas majore dicte ville pro tempore existen' et tres alios meliores discretiores & probes burgenses vill pred' pro tempore existen' et infra dietam villam tunc commoran' et inhabitantes ex numero eorum qui major dicte ville ante tunc fuer' er qui aldermann' di ville tunc existunt officium aldermannor' tunc in villa pred' incumben' et pro defectu talium tunc quatuor tres duos vel unum alium qui aldermanni dicte ville existet aut existent ibidem tunc com∣moran' et inhabitan' infra villam pred' n supplemen' dicrorum quatuor Qui quidem quatuor sic electi et nominat' similiter jurabunt supe sacrosancto Dei Evangelio quod ipsi quatuor vel major pars eorundem antequam ab irvicem decesserint tunc et ibidem super smili consultatione et communicatione inter eos habit' octo alios burgenses dicte ville secundum sanas suas discretione melio' probior' et discretior' quorum septem sint aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' si ibidem sint presentes et octavus eorum sit ex numero eorum qui tunc fuit aut ante tunc fuerunt vicecom' vill' et com' pred' infra dictam villam tunc commoran' et inhabitan' Et si non sint tant' alder∣mann' ville predicte pro tempore existen' tunc et ibidem presentes tunc dictus numerus suppleatur ex eis qui ante tunc fuerunt vicecom' vill' & com' illius et commoran' et tunc inhabitan' ibidem et pro defectu tal' tunc alios burgenses dicte ville melior' pro∣bior' & discretior' tunc et ibidem inhabitan' et commoran' eligerint nominaverint eligent et nominabunt sibi pred' quatuor burgenses adjungend' & connumerand' qui quidem quatuor burgenses et pred' octo eisdem adjungend' facient in toto numero duodecim Et quod postea probi homines et burgenses de pred' seperalibis duodecim societat' sive misteriis ville pred' sic ut presertur seperaliter congregat' vel major pars corundem sic congregat' et assemblat' in quolibet misterio suo in eodem die in suis sepe∣ralibus locis consuet' seperaliter & respective nominabunt et eligent de qualibet dicta societat' sive mister' unum talem vim qualiter dictis probis hominibus de qualibet dicta societate et mister' vel mri parti crundem sic ut prefertur seperaliter congregat' & assemblat' in seperalibus sui convencionibus idon' videbitur Qui quidem homine: sicut prefertur seperaliter noiti et electi sint et erunt duodecim in numero qui quidem duodecim vel totc eorum qui sic nominati electi et presentes fuerint presenta∣bunt dictis duodecim p lect' consisten' de majore alderman' & vicecom' vel hujusmodi qui vicecom' et burgenses ut predictum est qui prim' duodecim elector' vel major pars conrude present' nominabunt & eligent sex probos homines ex dictis duodecim elect' et sic ut prefertur ultim' presentat' predictos viros dictorum duodecim societat' sive mister' qua cum dictis primis duodeci in toto snt et crunt octodecim elector' in numero Et ulterius voluimus ordinavimus constituimus & concessi∣mus ac per presentes pro nobis heredibu & successoribu nostris volumus ordinams constituimus et concedimus dictis majori & burgensibus vill Novi Castri super Tinam quod quolil et anno in dicto die Lune proxime post pred' festum Sancti Michaelis Archangeli probi homines et langense de quindecem socetatibus in villa pred' inferius mentionat' scilicet magistri Anglice master mariners textores Anglice weavers barbitonsoe chirurgi Angelice surgeons una cum candellar' Anglice chandlers cuttel' Anglice cutles, nvm carp' Angelice masons manicr' Anglice lovers compnar' Anglice paners mlend' Anglice millers conriarii curriers lanc∣tor' lrkers et anntor' amorers cubota' Anglice collier una cum portator' Angelice carnage-men scandularii flaters viteram Anglice glaziers una cum phumbeat' Anglice plumbers et pror' Anglice painters isten' quandecem antiq' locitat' infra
am villam licite possnt et valeant in suis seperabilibus locis consuet' infra villam pred' seperaliter convenire et congregare Qui quidem probi homines et burgenses de pred' quindecim societatibus sic ta prefertur dicto die Lune proxime post pred' festum Sancti Michaelis Archangeli seperaliter congregat' et assemblat' seperaliter et respective nominabunt et eligent unum virum de qualibet dictarum quindecem societat' qui sic nominati et electi sint et erunt quindecem in numero Qui quidem quindecem per∣sone sic elect' et nominati vel major pars corundem postea eodem die eligent et nominabunt dodecim personas de omnibus liberis burgensibus ejusdem ville ad libitum suum utrum sint admiss' vel eorum aliquis sit admiss' de aliquo mister' sive societat' infra dictam villam tunc existen' sive non Qui quidem duodecim burgenses sic ultim', ut prefertur, elect' presentabunt dictis octodecem electoribus prius mencionat' Qui quidem octodecem eligent & nominabunt ex dictis duodecim ultim' mencionat' et ex sex aliis remanen' de et ex duodecim elect' ut prefertur per predict' duo∣decim societat' sive mister' primo nominat' sex probos homines Que quidem sex persone sic elect' et nominat' simul cum eisdem octodecim personis ultimo men∣cionat' facient numer' viginti quatuor personar' Qui quidem viginti quatuor sic elect' et nominat' jurabunt super sacrosancta Dei Evangelia quod ipsi vel major pars eorundem antequam ab invicem deccsserint tunc et ibidem super consultacion' & communication' inter eos prius habit' et omni favore odio et partialitate postposit' eligerent nominaverint eligent et nominabunt secundum sanas discretiones suas unum ex melior' discretior' & probior' burgens' dicte ville alderman' tunc ville pred' existen' fore majorem dicte ville pro uno anno integro tunc proxime sequen' si idem major sic elect' et nominat' tam diu vixerit et unum alium burgensem dicte ville idoneum fore vicecom' com' pred' ville Novi Castri super Tinam pro uno anno integro tunc proxini' sequen' si ipse idem vicecomes sic elect' et nominat' tam diu vixerit et similiter duos alius tunc burgenses ville pred' existentes aptos et idoneos fore corona∣tores pred' com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam pred' quolibet eorum in dicto officio suo remansur' pro uno anno integro tunc proxim' sequen' si ipsi iidem coronator' sic' elect' et nominat' tam diu vixerint atque simul modo et forma unum al' burgens' dicte ville tunc existen' fore clericum camere dicte ville pro uno anno integro tunc proxim' sequen' si ipse idem clericus camere dicte ville sic elect' et nominat' tam diu vixerit et se bene gesserit in eodem qui quidem clericus camere pro tempore existen' aut deputat' suus potestatem & authoritatem habeat et habebit in presencia camerar' dicte ville pro tempore existen' aut duorum eorum de tempore in tempus quando necesse fuerit ex∣hibend' et ministrand' hujusmodi jurament' corporal' quibuscunque naucleer' magistris navium nautis et eorum cuilibet ad portum Novi Castri super Tinam applican' prout ante hec tempora exhibere et ministrare usus fuit aut consuevit Et eodem modo et forma et eodem die quotannis dicti viginti quatuor burgens' elector' supra specificat' vel eorundem major pars eligent et nominabunt octo al' burgenses vill' pred' tunc existen' homines aptos et idon' fore camerar' ville pred' quolibet illorum in officio suo remansur' pro uno anno intgro tunc proxime sequen' si ipsi indem tamdiu vixerint et se bene gesserint in eodem ac similiter unum alium burgens' dicte ville tunc existen' fore ensiser' coram majore dicte ville pro tempore existen' in dicto officio remansur' pro uno anno integro tunc proximè sequen' si ipse idem ensiser sic elect' & nominat' tam diu vixerit et se bene gesserit in eodem et similiter octo alios burgenses ville pred' tunc existen' sore servient' ad clavam & ministri cur' nostra∣rum infra villam pred' tenend' ipsorum quolibet in dicto officio suo remansur' pro uno anno integro tunc proxime sequen' si ipsi tam diu vixerint et se bene gesserint in eodem Atque dicti viginti quatuor burgens' elector' supra specificat' aut eorum major pars eodem modo et forma atque eodem die quotannis eligent & nominabunt unum dis∣cretum virum et in legibus hujus regni nostri peritum et eruditum fore recordatorem vill' pred' quamvis hujusmodi persona sice. ect' et eligend' in recordator' dicte ville
non sit burgens vill' illius in dicto officio suo recordator' pro uno anno integro tunc proximè sequen' remansur' si ipse idem recordator sic elect' et nominat' tam diu vixerit et se bene gesserit in eodem officio Et insuper volumus et pro nobis & suc∣cessoribus nostris concedimus dictis majori et burgensibus et successoribus suis quod dicti viginti quatuor elector' sic elect' et nominat' ut prefertur vel major pars eorundem sint et erunt elector' pro uno anno integro tunc proxime sequen' omnium officiar' eligibil' dicte ville et com' in casu si acciderit aliquem vel aliquos officiar' sic elect' obire amoveri aut deponi infra annum proxim' post hujusmodi electionem de se fact' et si contingat aliquem dictorum viginti quatuor elector' obire infra ann' proxime post electionem ut prefertur de se fact' quod tunc et toties superviven' dictorum viginti quatuor vel major pars eorundem superviven' infra viginti dies proximè post hujusmodi mortem eligent et nominabunt al' dicte ville burgens' in dicta villa tunc residen' et in∣habitan' in eadem in supplement' dicti numeri dictorum viginti quatuor electorum Insuper volumus quod si contingat aliquem vel aliquos dictorum decem aldermannor' obire decedere deponi aut a loco vel locis suis amoveri tunc et toties et quoties aliquis hujusmodi casus acciderit dicti viginti quatuor elector' pro tempore existen' vel major pars eorundem in presencia dicti majoris infra viginti dies tunc proximè post hujus∣modi obit' decessum aut amocionem alicujus vel aliquorum aldermannorum pred' eligent et nominabunt et eligere et nominare possint et valeant alium aut alios bur∣gensem vel burgenses dicte ville pro tempore existen' et residen' et inhabitan' in eodem fore aldermann' vel aldermannos dicte ville loco vel locis hujusmodi reddit' & cion' omnes computos camerat' dicte ville pro tempore pred' existen' reddit' & ton' dicte ville et de omnibus prosic' corum ssi' camerat' tangen' et quod dic alnes vel corum aliquis vel aliqui non acciprunt repunt aut allorent aliquod vel al ua sibi vel cametat' pred aut cor alicum vel aliquibus pro tempore existen' de robin' reven∣tionibus aut denar' summis dictis major' & burgensibus et successoribus suis pertinen' sive spectan' aut de recept' aut prob' offic' suorum camerat' aut corum alicujus pro labore suo in hujusmodi mister' sive o' suis impens' vel impendend' sed solammoda hujusmodi allocation' que sint vel sorem allocat' et fact' per majorem et reliquos de communi confilio ejusdem ville pro tempore existen' vel majorem partem corundem (unde dict' major' & sex aldermatim' ejusdem ville septem esse volumus) pro aliqu par¦ticular' denar' summa exposit' et disbursit' exponend' et disbursand' et quod hujusmodi auditores et corum qualibet in omnibus, se gerat et gerant secundum tenorem ben decreti sive ordinacionis textio et quarto annis regnorum Domini Philippi & Dre
Marie nupe Regis & Regine Anglie per Nicholaum tunc cancellar' Anglie Willielmi tunc marchion' Winton' tunc ma saur' Angl' prenobiles de consilio privat' ejusdem Regis & Regne inde habit' laria nostra de record' irrotular' Et insuper volumus & ner presente , & successoribus nostris damus et concedimus dict' or' burgen' quod omnes auditores pred' sic nominat' et appunctuat' insim hai quolibet die quo in exequend' premissa & compor' pred' audiend' in & quod quilibet eorum auditor' antequam premissa excepti pr pon prefict eoram majore dicte ville pro tempore existen' pro officium hear and reasonably attend ye accounts of the chamberlai of fir ∣present year touching all manner of issues profitts' & comm ing to the mayor & burgesses of this town of Newcastle upon Tyne as hath been and no allowance make but such as are of which shall be allowed and made by the mayor and the rest of the common council of the same town of the most part of them whereof the present mayor and six aldermen to be seven for any particualr or summ or only laid forth & disbursed or to be laid forth and disbursed this present year whereof the said mayor & burgesses may be duely assured and satisfied of the said issues & pro∣fitts in every respect So help you God Volumus etiam ac per presentes pro nobis hered' & successoribus nostris concedimus prefat' majori & burgensibus ville pred' & succes∣soribus suis quod major recordator & aldermann' ville pred' pro tempore existen' qum∣que vel plures eorum quorum prefat' major' & recordator' duos esse volumus de tem∣pore in tempus in futur' sint justiciarii nostri hered' & successor' nostror' ad gaol' ville pred' de prisonar' in eadem existen' eidem gaole quacunque causa committend' de tempore in tempus deliberand' et quod vicecomes & coronatores vill' com' pred' et eorum quilibet pro tempore existen' omnia jurat' inquisitiones panel' attachiament' et indentur' per ipsos et eorum quemlibet capt' et imposterum capiend' coram prefat' majore recordator' & aldermann' vill' pred' pro tempore existen' quinque vel pluribus eorem quorum prefat' majorem & recordatorem duos esse volumus cum et quoties gaol' ill' de prison' in ea existen' deliberare voluerint de tempore in tempus facient re∣torn' ac eis in omnibus deliberacionibus gaol' tangen' sint attendent' et precept' eorum major' recordator' et aldermannor' pro tempore existen' quinque vel plur' eorum quorum prefat' major' & recordator' duos esse volumus exequatur de tempore in temp eisdem modo et forma prout aliquis vicecomes seu coronator in aliqo com' insia reg∣num nostrum Anglie ad gaol' in aliquibus com' dicti regni nostri Anglie hered' & nostror' deliberand' facere retumar intendere et exequi quo per le regni nosri Anglie consueverunt Quodque idem ma recorditur & alde & successores quinque vel plures eorum quorum dictum & duos este volumus habeant & hebebunt potestatem & ' et egere de possint & valeant surcas infri vill; vel libertates pred' vill' ad vill' pred' et com' ejusdem vill' seadum & cones Angl' adat' suspendend' et quod major recor & aldermmann' vill' pred' pro tempore existen' quinque vel plures eorum quorum d" majorem & recordator' duos esso volumus quoscunque murdiator' felon' & al' malefactores infra vill' vel com' pred' vel precinct' vel libertates eorundem invent' per se aut per ministros aut deputatos suos in vill' pred' capere et attestare ac eos usque gaol' perducere possint ibidem salvo custod' quo que per debitum legis processum deliberantum aliqua al' ordinacione decretp conser∣dine in contrarium non abstante Insuper pro mehoracione ejusdem ville voltanus et per literas nostras patentes intentionem nostram regiam gratiosam erga burgense ejus∣dem
ville Novi Castri super Tinam declarand' dicti' majori & burgensibus & succes∣soribus suis pro nobis hered' & success' nostris damus & concedimus per presentes quod quilibet lib er burgensis vill' pred' (sib er burgensis ejusdem vill' existen') aut qui in ur' liber burgensis ejusdem ville so natione debiti servitii sui tanquam apprentie' alicui libero burgs' alicujus liberi mister' in vili' pred' usitat' vel ratione quod hujus∣modi liber argentis in auterir silius alieujusal burgensis qual' suit aut erit bur∣gensis per debit' servitium suum tanquam apprentic' alieur libero rgensi alicuju liberi misterii in vill' pred' us v' et non al' aut alii admitti possit aut debeat in fraternitatem de le hostmen vill' pre' et ut frater dicte fraternitatis de le hostmen habeatur et in om∣nibus tract ipsm expostulaverit & solvat super adnassiome, suam in dic' fraternit u' gbernator' seneschallis & fratribus dret' fraternitatis vel eorum mi∣nii' aut officur' in hac parte quinquaginta tres solid' et quatuor denar' legalis monete Anglie & non plus et quelibet persona que sit vel suit liber burgensis ejusdem ville ratione quod sit filius vel apprentic' alicujus fratris dict' fraternitatis de le hostmen ad∣mitti possit et debeat in fraternitat' de le hostmen pred' ut frater dicte fraternitatis de le hostmen habeatur & in omnibus tractetur si ipsum expostulaverit et quelibet hujus∣modi persona sic adiss' vel admittend' in dict' fraternitat' de le hostmen solvat pro & super admissinem suam pred' gubernator' seneschall' & fratribus dicte fraternitatis pro tempore existen' ver' eorum officiar' vel ministr' in hac parte triginta & tres solid' & quatuor denat' et mplius Ac ulterius ex ampliori gratia nostra ac ex certa sci∣cutia & mero meo mn volumus a per presentes pro nobis hered' & successoribus notris dama pred' majori & burgensibus & successoribus suis quod ipsi villum pred' membris & pertinen' universis ac etiam omnes hujus∣di ' priveleg' francherias immunitates exemptiones quretanc' & cunque quant' sibi aut predecessoribus suis per char ali prum progenitorum nostrorum antehac concess' fuere que non ' vel repugnan' libertat' & concession' in hiis literis nostris paten∣tibus necnon omnia et singula eidem et hujusmodi consuetud' quietanc' & exemptiones jurisdictiones & Novo Castello super Tinam et que burgenses vill' Novi Castri super aliquis vel alia per qcunque incorporation vel visi fuerunt dpan gdere debrunt sunt sive vel' cor∣ titulo repugnan' liber∣ & nuss & sucrib et simiter papr pro nobis quod prod' major & burgenses vile prod et su∣sores
sui imperpetuum habeant omnes hujusmodi libertates consuetudines privelegia franchesias immunitates exemptiones quietanc' jurisdictiones et cetera omnia & singula premiss' cum suis pertinen' que non sunt contrar' vel' repugnantes libertat' & concession' in hiis literis nostris patentibus express' dat' et concess' & eisdem de cetero libere et e impedimento alicujus utantur imperpetuum aliquo abusu non usu vel forisfactur' in contrar' in aliquo non obstante Volumus etiam ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris concedimus prefat' major' & burgensibus vill' pred' &; successoribus fuis quod habeant & habebunt has literas nostras patentes sub magno sigillo nostro Anglie debito modo factas & sigillat' absque fine seu feodo magno vel parvo nobis Hanaperio nostro feu alibi ad usum nostrum proinde quoquomodo reddend' solvend' seu faciend' eo quod expressa mentio de vero valore annuo aut de aliquo alio valore vel de certitudine premissorum seu eorum alicujus aut de aliis donis sive concessionibus per nos seu per aliquem antecessor' sive progenitor' nostror' prefat' majori & burgensibus ante hec tempora fact' in presentibus minimè fact' existit aut aliquo statut' atui ordina∣cione provisione proclamatione seu restrictione in contrar' inde ante hec habit' fact' edit' ordinat' seu provis' aut aliqua al' re causa vel materia quacunque in aliquo non obstante In cujus rei testimon' has literas nostras fieri fecimus patentes Teste meipso apud Westm' tricesimo primo die Marcii anno regni nostri Anglie Franc' et Hibernie secundo et Scotie tricesimo septimo

DIV3.HEAD: Here follows King Charles II.'s confirmation of the above, and Queen Elizabeth's Great Charter.
DIV3.P:
SCIATIS modo quod nos melioracionem ville nostre Novi Castri super Tinam pred' et prosperam conditionem populi nostri ibidem gratiose affectantes ac seperal' literas patentes pred' & omnia et singula in eisdem content' rata habentes et grata ad humilem petitionem dilectorum subditorum nostrorum modo majoribus & burgensibus vill' illius de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia & mero motu nostris voluimus con∣cessimus ratificavimus & confirmavimus ac per presentes pro nobis heredibus successori∣bus nostris volumus concedimus ratificamus & confirmamus prefat' major' & burgensi∣bus vill' Novi Casti super Tinam pred' et successoribus suis seperales literas parentes pred' ac omnia & singula in eisdem respective content' ac etiam omnes et omnimod' libertat' liberas consuetudines franchesias immunitates exemptiones quietancias & juris∣dictiones vill' illius quascunque necnon omnia & singula eadem et hujusmodi terras tenementa guildeos fraternitat' mercata ferias consuetudines libertates privelegia franches' immunitates quietanc' exemptiones jurisdictiones & hereditamenta quecunque que probi homines vill' de Novo Castello super Tinam & que burgenses Novi Castri super Tinam et que burgenses et probi homines vill' Novi Castri super Tinam et que communitas vill' Novi Castri super presat' Tinam et que major et burgenses vill' Novi Castri super Tinam aut eorum aliquis vel aliqui per quecunque nomina sive quodeunque nomen vel per quamcunque incorporationem vel pretextu cujuscunque incorporationis antchac habuerunt tenuerunt usi vel gavisi fuer' aut habere tenere uti vel gaudere debuer' hab tenuit usus vel gavisus suit sive debuit vittute vel pretextu aliquarum chartatum aut literarum patent' per nos vel per aliquem progenitor' nostror' quoquomodo antcha∣fact' confirmat' vel concess' seu quocunque alio legal' modo nomine consuetudine usu prescriptione sive titulo antchac legitime usitat' habit' gavis' sive consuet' et quod ∣tum sit ei erit eisdem majori & burgensibus vill' pred' & successoribus sius habere te exercere uti et gandere omnibus et omnimod' hujusmodi libertatibus libe consu ali∣nibus franches' immunitatibus executionibus jurisdictionibus privelegiis & ceter pre∣missis pred' superius per presentes in forma pred' ratificat' et confirm in tam ampl∣modo et forma ad omina intentiones & proposita qual' temporibus retroactis usi vel gavito fuer' seu habere tenere uti vel gaudere debuere aut debuit habend' tenend' & gaudend'
omnia premissi pred' superius per presentes concess' ratificat' seu confirmat' aut fore concess' ratificat' seu confirmat' prefat' majori & burgensibus vill' Novi C uper Tinam pred' et successoribus suis ad usum eorundem major' et bur∣gensium successor' orum imperpetuum tenend' de nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris in doo firme ut prius tenebantur ac reddend' & solvend' proinde nobid hered' & successoribus nostris antiquam feod' firmam cent' librar' legalis monete Angl' ad festum Sancti Michaelis Archangeli tantum pro omnibus al' servitiis exactionibus & demand' proinde nobis heredibus vel successoribus nostris reddend' solvend' ve; faciend' Quare volumus ac per presentes firmiter injungend' precipimus pro nobis heredibus & succes∣soribus nostris quod predict' major & burgenses vill' nostre Novi Castri super Triam pred' et successores sui habeant teneant utantur & gaudeant ac habere tenere uti gau∣dere et exercere valeant et possint imperpetuum omnibus libertatibus authoritatibus jurisdictionibus consuetudinibus concessionibus franchesiis quietanc' tarris tenemen' & hereditamentis predictis actionibus bonis & catallis suis quibuscunque secundum tenorem formam & effectum harum literarum nostrarum patentium sinc occasione molecione vel impedimento nostri heredum vel successorum nostrorum justic vicecom' ector' ballivorum aut aliorum ministrorum nostrorum heredum aut successorum nostrorum quoruncunque nolentes quod iidem major et burgenses aut successores sui seu eorum aliquis vel aliqui ratione premissorum seu eorum alicujus per nos heredes vel succes∣sores nostros justiciar' vicecomites escactores ballivos seu alios ministros nostros hered' vel successor' nostrorum quoscunque occasionentur molestentur vexentur graventur seu in aliquo perturbentur volentes etiam et per presentes pro nobis hered' & successoribus nostris mandantes per presentes tam thesaurar' cancellar' baronibus scaccarii nostri Wesm' ac aliis & justiciar' nostris heredum et successorum nostrorum quam attornato & sollicitatori nostro generali pro tempore existen' & eorum cuilibet ac omnibus aliis ministris & officiariis nostris heredum & successor' nostrorum quibuscunque pro tempore existen' quod nec ipsi nec eorum alteri vel alicujus aliquod breve sive summonicion' de quo warranto vel aliquod seu aliqua al' breve vel brevia processum vel processus nostri quecunque versus prefat' majorem & burgenses vill' pred' aut eorum aliquem vel aliquos pro aliquibus causis materiis rebus clameis vel offens' per ipsus feu corum aliquos attemptat' clamat' ufitat' habil' fact 'sive perpetrat' ante confectionem harum literarum nostrarum patentium impetrantur prosequantur vel continuantur aut impetrari prosequi vel continuare faciunt aut causant seu eorum aliquis facit aut causat volentes etiam quod iidem major et burgenses seu eorum aliqui vel aliquis per aliquem vel aliquos justiciar' vicecom' officiarior' vel ministror' nostrorum in aut pro debito usu &c clameo aut in debito abusu seu clameo aliquorum liberta∣tum privileg' franches' aut jurisdiction' insia vill' pred' limites et precinct' ejusdem ante diem confectionis harum literarum nostrarum paten' minime molestantur aut im∣pediantur aut ad vel pro eisdem seu eorum aliquo respondere compellantur sed quod sidem major et burgenses et eorum quilibet abinde & de & ab omni et omnimod' ac∣cione impeticione & prosecutione per breve de quo warranto versus ipsos seu eoum aliquem per nos heredes vel successores nostros occasione premissor' seu eorum alicujus habend' seu prosequend' penitus exonerati & acquietati sint & erunt et quilibet eorum et erit per presentes proviso semper & volumus per presentes pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris ordinamus et firmiter injungend' precipimus quod major recordator alderman' burgens' communis clericus et omnes al' officiat' & ministri nostri vill' nostrie Novi Castri super Tynam pred' et eorum deput' nec non omnes justiciat' ad pacem nostram hered' & successor' nostrorum infra vill' pred' virtute aut secundum tenorum harum literarum nostraram patentium seu aliquarum alterarum paten' sive artar' ante∣hac fact' modo constitut' seu imposterum nominand' eligend' seu constituend' ante∣quam ipsi ad executionem sive exercitium officii vel officior' loci vel locorum i vel
quibus sic respective nominat' appunctuat' sive constitut' modo existunt aut imposterum nominat' elect' sive constitut' fuer' admittantur aut aliqualiter in ea parte intromittant seu eorum aliquis respective intromittat tam facramentum corporal' communiter vocat' the oath of obcdience quam sacramentum corporal' communiter vocat' the oath of supremacy super sacrosanct' Dei Evangel' prestiterint & quilibet eorum prestabit eoram tal' person' sive talibus personis qual' et que ad hujusmodi sacram' dand' et prestand' per legem et statut' hujus regni nostri Anglie ad presens appunctuantur & designantur aut imposterum appunctuat' vel designat' fuer' vel fuerint Et ulterius volumus & in∣tentionem regiam nostram declaramus quod nullus recordator nec communis clericus vill' pred' de cetero eligend' sive constituend' intromittant in hujusmodi officio sive officiis seu eorum altero respective antequam ipsi et corum quilibet respective approbat' vel approbati fuerint vel fuerit per nos hered' vel successores nostros aliquo in presenti∣bus content' aut aliqua alia re causa vel materia quacunque in contrarium inde in aliquo non obstante ita tamen et voluntas nostra regia est quod hujusmodi approbacio non extendat ad Robertum Shafto arm' modo recordatorem vill' pred' in aliqua electione de eo annuatim imposterum fiend' eo quod ipsum Robertum in officio illo recordatoris vill' pred' approbamus eo quod expressa mencio &c. In cujus rei &c. Teste Rege apud Westm' decimo tertio die Februarii.

DIV3.HEAD: (The following note is subjoined.)
DIV3.P: "I examined this with a copy which was produced at the bar of the House of Lords, 24th February, 1717, and sworn to be a true copy. G. G.
"And I re-examined it carefully March 17th & 19h, 1743. G. G."

N. B. This clause of the King's approving of the recorder and town-clerk is new, and not in former charters; and as this charter of Charles II. is only a charter of con∣firmation, and not granted npon a surrender of former charters and franchises, it is doubtful whethcr this clause doth restrain the former liberties and charters of the cor∣poration. Vide Raym. 439. Comb. 316. 1 Salkeld 168. Skinner 5769. The method of electing officers in a corporation by an old charter, cannot be altered by a new charter; but acting under the new charter, is an evidence of their consent making it good.

The King cannot resume an interest he hath already granted, unless the grantee concur. But in this case, the corporation hath concurred by accepting it, and pro∣ceeding accordingly, which is an evidence of their consent.

DIV3.HEAD: (From Grey's MSS.)
DIV3.P: Ao. 1684, Sir Nath. Johnson wrote a letter to the corporation that the King ex∣pected a surrender' of their charter, or that the mayor, recorder, sheriff, and town-clerk, might be always in the King's power to appoint or confirm; upon which the corporation sent a petition to the King, signed by Sir William Blatkett, mayor, and all the common-council (which is entered in the book of orders), whereby they desire the King to confirm their ancient privileges, and promise and agree that the mayor, re∣corder, sheriff, and town-clerk, shall be of his Majesty's appointing.
They again address the King by Sir Geo. Jeffreys when he came judge this circuit, July, anno 1684, and promise the same thing.
A Quo Warranto served February 11th, 1687.

March 7th, 1687, a surrender of their charter is actually sealed, and sent up—(Sir William Creagh, mayor, went to London, March 13th, with the surrender)—Qu. if it was inrolled? N. B. Tlns is all entered in the book of orders.

Vide proclamation to restore charters—printed in the State Tracts, vol. i. p. 49, by which it appears that the surrender of Newcastle charter was not inrolled. In a letter dated 3d November, 1688, subscribed by Silvester Petyt, and directed to Mr. Douglas, are these words: "As for the-proclamation and orders touching the cor∣porations, I was at the Crown-office, and the clerk told me they were all sent under seal to all the corporations, and that Green, a messenger, had those for Newcastle, and believes you have them before this; and because you think the Gazet not sufficient, I have sent you the proclamation and order printed by the King's printers, and think you may (if the other be not come) give credit to these."

DIV3.HEAD: A Case concerning the Surrender of Charters to King James II. and the opinion of Mr. Holt, who was afterwards lord chief justice of the King's Bench, taken just before King William came in.
DIV3.P: THE mayor, aldermen, and common-counsel, A. D. 1684, surrendered to the King the magisterial part of their charter (but it was not inrolled), and the King granted a new charter, and therein constituted several new aldermen, reserving a power to dis∣place the mayor and aldermen at his pleasure, signified by an order of the privy seal.

Afterwards the King (by virtue of the power in the new charter) by mandamus, December 24th, turns out the mayor and aldermen; and Ao. 1687 appoints others who are chosen in their places, who make another surrender of the charter (March 7th, 1687) more at large than the former surrender (but this last surrender was not inrolled), and a new charter granted, in which a power is reserved in the King to place or displace.

Then the King makes an order to displace the new mayor, aldermen, and all officers; and by a proclamation, 17th October, 1688, requires the corporations whose surren∣ders were not inrolled, to take upon them to act as corporations, and where places were vacant by death, or otherwise, to fill them up, and an order of counsel for the purpose.
Qu. 1. If this proclamation doth repeal the two last charters without scire facias?
R. I conceive the new charters are void, because the first was not surrendered, nor was that surrender of the power of making magistrates inrolled, and there need no scire facias.

Qu. 2. If the aldermen who were displaced by the powers in the first new charter, and had been aldermen before the surrender, are again aldermen, and may by law act as such by virtue of the proclamation and order of counsel?
R. Those who were aldermen by the old charter before any surrender, are alder∣men, and may by law act as such.
Qu. 3. If those officers in the corporation, who had offices for a year, must not be rechosen before they can act?

R. In most corporations the mayor, and other officers who are annual, continue af∣ter the expiration of the year, until another be sworn; therefore I think it sit that he that was mayor at the time of the first surrender, do surrender his office of mayor, and then that the corporation proceed to a new election of a new mayor, as in case of death of a mayor; and after the election of the mayor, and his being sworn, let the sheriff and other officers (that are annual) and were in office at the time of the first surrender, resign their offices, and then let the corporation proceed to the electing and swearing new ones in their places.

Qu. 4. What electors must choose officers into vacant offices, whether those that were electors for that year (in which) the charter was first surrendered (the electors being chosen only for a year), or the election to be made by summoning the several com∣panies and societies, who used annually on Michaelmas Monday to make an election of the mayor and other officers?

R. Let new electors be chosen for the residue of the year ensuing before the mayor makes his resignation of his office, and let their election be according to custome, for the proclamation gives them this power, though the usual day be past.
Qu. 5. Whether those new-made freemen by mandates, or the last mentioned char∣ters, pattents or grants, can claim any benefit or advantage thereby, or are such free∣doms extinguished?
R. Such freedoms as were made since the first surrender are void.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 196. Anno 1o Gull. & Mariae. An Act for erecting a Court of Conscience at Newcastle upon Tyne.

LETTER.P:
WHEREAS it hath been found by long experience, that the erecting of a court for recovery of small debts, and relieving of poor debtors in London, under the value of forty shillings, hath been of great benefit and advantage to the poore sort of freemen and inhabitants of the said city, and hath prevented many great mischiefs and inconveniencies that would otherwise have fallen upon them by the charges of arrest and other processe & proceedings in law; and forasmuch as the towne and county of the towne of Newcastle upon Tyne is very large and populous, consisting of many poor freemen, artificers, labourers, and others inhabiting therein, amongst whom, for want of the like good order and establishment, divers vexatious suits for divers debts, and in several actions upon the case upon assumpsits have been and are commenced and prosecuted as well in the courts at Westminster as in other courts or places, which hath been and is the occasion of much more expence to the parties than the respective debts and causes of action for which they sue have amounted unto, to the ruine of them, their wives and children, and by meanes thereof great charges to the corporation for their support and maintenance have been contracted and occasioned; for remedy whereof, be it enacted by the King and Queen's most excellent Majesties, by and with the ad∣vice and consent of the Lords spirituall and temporall and Commons in this present par∣liament assembled, and by authority of the same, that there be a court to be commonly called or known by the name of a Court of Requests, or Conscience, for reliese of the poorer sort of people in small debts and actions upon the case upon assumpsits in the towne and county of the towne of Newcastle upon Tyne erected and established, and such court is hereby erected and established for and within the said towne and county of the towne of Newcastle upon Tyne, to have continuance for ever; and that the maior, aldermen, and common-council of the said towne for the time being (or the major part of them) whereof the mayor and six aldermen to be seaven, shall and are hereby impowered and required from time to time once in every yeare to nominate, elect, and choose such and soe many persons as they shall think fitt, not being under the
number of thirteen, whereof six at least to be aldermen, and the rest common-council men of the said towne, who, together with the mayor or senior alderman of the same towne for the time being, shall be and are hereby enacted, declared and appointed to be commissioners for the holding the said Court of Request, or Conscience, as here∣after is expressed, and to continue commissioners as aforesaid for the space of one yeare from the time of their choice, and from thence until others shall be from time to time chosen in their stead; and that the mayor, aldermen, and common-council of the said town of Newcastle upon Tyne, now and for the time being, or the major part of them, whereof the mayor and six aldermen to be seaven, shall have full power and authority to nominate, elect and appoint such persons as they shall thinke fitt to be register or clerke, and bedle, or other officer or officers of and for the said court, and them to remove and displace from the said offices or imployments when and as often as they shall see cause. And be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that the said com∣missioners, or any three or more of them, whereof the mayor or one alderman of the said towne to be one, shall and are hereby authorized and required from time to time to meet and assemble themselves on such day or days in every week and in such place within the said towne of Newcastle as shall be appointed and ascertained by the mayor, aldermen, and common-council of Newcastle aforesaid for the time being, or the major part of them, whereof the maior and six aldermen to be seaven. And the said commissioners, or any three or more of them, whereof the mayor or one alderman as aforesaid to be one, shall and hereby have full power and authority to heare and deter∣mine all matters of debt and actions upon the case upon assumpsits not amounting to 40s. debt or damages to be brought before them according to the purport, true in∣tent and meaning of this act. And be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that every person and persons inhabiting or that shall inhabit within the said towne and county of the said towne of Newcastle upon Tyne, or any the liberties there unto be∣longing, whether free or not free of the said towne, which now hath or hereafter shall have any debt or debts, summe or summes of money not amounting to the summe or value of 40s. due or owing unto him, her or them, by any person or persons that doth or shall inhabite within the towne or libertyes aforesaid, and whether free or not free of the said towne, shall and may cause such debtor or debtors to be warned or summoned by the beadle or other officer of the said court hereby erected, by writing left at the house or place of abode of such debtor or debtors, or by other reasonable warning as notice to be given to the said debtor or debtors to appeare before the said commissioners of the said Court of Conscience, or any three or more of them, to be holden as aforesaid, whereof the mayor or one alderman to be one: And that the said commissioners or any three or more of them as aforesaid, whereof the mayor or one alderman to be one, shall have power and authority by virtue of this act from time to time to sett downe such order or orders to be made between such party and partyes, complaynants, and his, her or their debtor or debtors, defendants, touching such debts or actions upon the case upon assumpsits not amounting to the full value of 40s. in question before the said commissioners, as they shall find to stand with equity and good conscience, in a sum∣mary way, and with or without adjournment, not holding themselves to the exact or usuall formes or methods of the common law or other courts of justice: And the suc∣ceeding commissioners shall proceed in the causes which were depending before their predecessors, and make orders therein as if commenced before themselves, all which said order or orders to be made as aforesaid shall be finall and conclusive to all persons therein concerned, their executors and administrators. Nor shall any writt of error, certioari, appeale or processe in law or equity, lye or be allowed for the removall, stay or reversall of the same. All such their orders to be registred in a booke or bookes fairly written to be kept in the said court, and as well the plaintiffe as defendant to be
bound thereby, and to observe and keep the same in all points; and for the due pro∣ceedings therein, it shall and may be lawfull for the said commissioners, or any three or more of them, whereof the mayor or one alderman as aforesaid to be one, to minister an oath to the complaynant or defendant, and also to such witnesses as shall be pro∣duced on behalfe of each party touching the matters in question or relating thereto, if the said commissioners or any three or more of them, whereof the mayor or one alder∣man to be one, shall soe think it meete. And be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that before any of the said commissioners or any other commissioners to be hereafter chosen or appointed in pursuance of this act shall enter upon the execution of the authorities herein conteyned, he and they shall take the oath following before the recorder of the said towne for the time being, who is hereby impowered to administer the same, that is to say: I A. B. doe promise and sweare, that all such matters and causes as I shall order or determine by vertue or an act of parliament for erecting a Court of Conscience at Newcastle upon Tyne, I will order and determine with justice and equity, according to the best of my knowledge and understanding. So help me God. And be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that if any such creditor or debtor, after warning given to him, her or them in manner and forme before in this act mentioned by any officer of the said Court of Conscience, shall without some just and rea∣sonable cause or excuse allowed by the said court, refuse to appeare in the said court, or before the said commissioners or any three or more of them as aforesaid, or shall not performe such order as the said commissioners shall sett downe for or concerning such debts as aforesaid, or the payment or allowance of any costs or damages for or in re∣spect of the same; that then upon oath thereof made before the said commissioners or any three or more of them as aforesaid (which oath they have hereby power to ad∣minister) it shall be lawful for the beadle or other officer or officers of the said court by order of the said commissioners or any three or more of them as aforesaid, to levy such debt or debts, damages or money by the said court awarded or ordered to be paid by and out of the goods and chattells of such creditor or debtor, plaintisse or defendant, by distresse and sale of the same, returning the overplus, if any be, to the party or partyes: And if sufficient of the goods and chattells of such party or partyes cannot be found within the jurisdiction of the said court whereby or wherewith such debt or debts, costs or damages so awarded, shall or may be levyed, raised and satisfied; then it shall be law∣full for such officer or officers of the said court, by order of the said commissioners or any three or more of them as aforesaid, to carry and convey such party or partyes to the prison of the said towne of Newcastle upon Tyne and county of the same, there to re∣maine without baile or mainprize untill he, she or they shall performe and fulfill the order and decree of the said court. And if any person or persons inhabiting or that shall in∣habite within the said towne or county of the towne of Newcastle upon Tyne aforesaid, or any the liberties thereunto belonging, shall at any time after the first day of August next ensuing, commence or prosecute any action or suite in any of the courts of West∣minster, or in any other court (except the court hereby established), against any person inhabiting or resideing, or that shall inhabite or reside within the said towne or county of the said towne, or any the libertyes thereof or thereunto belonging, for any debt o summe of money due upon contract or promise, which upon the tryall shall be found not to amount to the value of forty shillings over and above costs, no judgement shall be entred of record upon any such verdict where the debt and damages shall be found at lesse than 40s. besides costs of suite; and also the defendant in any such action shall have his full costs of the said suite to be taxed by the said court or their proper officer where such action shall be tryed, and payd him by such plaintiffe in the said cause, and shall have execution or remedy for the same, any law or custome to the contrary in anywise notwithstanding: Provided always that this act or any thing
therein conteyned shall not extend to any debt for rent upon any lease of landes or tenements, nor to any reall contracts, nor to any other debt that shall arise by vertue or reason of any cause concerning testaments, matrimony, or other things properly be∣longing to the Ecclesiastical Court, albeit the same be under 40 shillings, any thing herein before conteyned to the contrary notwithstanding: Provided always, and be it enacted, that the register or clerke of the said courte for the time being shall take noe more or greater fees than are hereafter appointed, that is to say for every plaint 2d. for every appearance 2d. for every order 3d. and for entering of the said order 3d. more; for every precept or warrant to committ to prison 4d. for every search 2d. for every warrant for seizing and disposing of goods and chattells pursuant to this act 4d. for every satisfaction acknowledged upon an order 3d. and that the beadle or other officer of the said court for the time being shall take noe more than 2d. for warning every person, nor more than 4d. for serving every precept or warrant, any law, cus∣tome or usage to the contrary notwithstanding.

POSTSCRIPT.P: Examined this with the clerk of the parliament as a true copy of the originall.

DIV3.HEAD: "Anno 27 Geo. II. cap. xvi. § 2.
DIV3.P: "WHEREAS many inconveniences have arisen by reason several acts for erect∣ing Courts of Requests or Conscience in several cities, towns corporate, and other places, have not been declared to be publick acts; be it therefore enacted, that from and after the 1st day of January, one thousand seven hundred and fifty-five, all the acts of par∣liament for erecting Courts of Requests or Conscience, for the recovery of small debts in cities, towns corporate, and other places in this kingdom, shall be deemed, adjudged and taken to be publick acts, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such by all judges, justices, and other persons whatsoever, without specially pleading the same."

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 227. (No. 1.) Charter to Merchant-Adventurers, Newcastle.
DIV2.P:
EDWARDUS sextus Dei gratia Anglie Francie & Hibernie Rex Fidei De∣fensor & in terra ecclesie Anglicane & Hybernice supremum caput omnibus ad quos presentes litere pervenerint salutem Sciatis quod nos ob amorem &c favorem quos erga villam nostram Novicastri super Tinam ac com' ejusdem ville & erga illos dilectos & fideles nostros mercatores venturarios vocatos merchant venturers inhabitantes infra dictam villam & com' ejusdem vill' nostre Novicastri qui modo sunt de societate mer∣cator' venturarior' in partibus Brabantie in partibus transmarinis gerimus & habems de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia & mero motu nostris nec non de advisa∣mento & assensu precarissimi avunculi nostri Edwardi Ducis Somerset gubernatoris
persone nostre ac regnor' dominior' & subditor' nostror' quorumcumque protectoris, nec non ceteror' consiliarior' nostror' concessimus & per presentes concedimus & volumus pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris quod iidem mercatores ven∣tuarii qui modo sunt habitantes infra dictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' ac de predicta societate mercator' venturarior' in predictis partibus Brabantie sint re facto & nomine una societas & unum corpus incorporatum de se im∣perpetuum & habeant successionem perpetuam Et ulterius ex assensu predict' assignamus nominamus constituimus facimus & ordinamus per presentes dilectum & fidelem sub∣ditum nostrum Henricum Anderson unum predictor' mercator' venturarior' habitancium infra predict' villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam fore gubernatorem dicte societatis mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam ad exercend' officium gubernatoris ejusdem societatis usque nonam diem Octobris nunc prox' futur' ac ipsum Henr' Anderson gubernator' ejusdem societat' usque dictum nonum diem Octobris prox' futur' assignamus nominamus con∣stituimus facimus decremus ordinamus & creamus per presentes Ac etiam de avisamento & assensu predict' assignavimus nominavimus constituimus fecimus & ordinavimus ac per presentes assignamus nominamus constituimus & ordinamus dilectos & fideles sub∣ditos nostros Robertum Brandeling Robertum Lewen Georgium Davell Marcum Shaftoe Cutbertum Ellisson Robertum Brigham Willielmum Carr Bartholomeum Bee Rogerum Midford Thomam Bewyke Bartramum Anderson & Oswaldum Chapman duodecem predictor' mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predict' villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam fore assistentes prefato gubernatori & successoribus fuis usque predictum nonum diem Octobris prox' futur' ac ipsos Robertum Brandeling Robertum Lewen Georgium Davell Marcum Shaftoe Cuthbertum Ellisson Robertum Brigham Willielmum Carr Bartholomeum Bee Rogerum Midford Thomam Bewyke Bartramum Anderson & Oswaldum Chapman assistentes eidem gubernatori & successoribus fuis usque dictum nonum diem Octobris prox' futur' assignamus nominamus constituimus facimus decremus & creamus per presentes Ac etiam assignavimus nominavimus con∣stituimus fecimus & ordinavimus ac per presentes ex assensu predict' assignamus nomi∣namus constituimus facimus & ordinamus dilectos & fideles subditos nostros Bar∣tramum Bewyke & Johannem Rawe duos pred' mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam fore guardianos ejusdem socie∣tatis mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' usque predict' nonum diem Octobris prox' futur' ac ipsos Bartramum Bewyke & Johannem Rawe gardianos ejusdem societat' usque dictum nonum diem Octobris prox' futur' assignamus nominamus constituimus facimus decremus ordinamus & creamus per presentes Et ulterius per presentes ex assensu predict' assignamus nomi∣namus constituimus facimus decremus ordinamus & creamus predictos Henricum Anderson Robertum Brandeling Robertum Lewen Georgium Davell Marcum Shaftoe Cuthbertum Ellesson Robertum Brigham Willielmum Carr Bartholomeum Bee Rogerum Midford Thomam Bewyke Bartramum Anderson Oswaldum Chapman Bar∣tramum Bewyke & Johannem Rawe ac omnes illos alios mercatores habitantes infra dictam vill' nostram & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam qui modo sunt de pre∣dicta societate predictorum mercatorum venturarior' in predictis partibus Brabantie fore fociet' mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predict' vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' Et quod iidem Henricus Anderson Robertus Brandeling Ro∣bertus Lewen Georgius Davell Marcus Shaftoe Cutbertus Ellesson Robertus Brigham Willielmus Carr Bartholomeus Bee Rogerus Midford Thomas Bewyke Bartramus Anderson Oswaldus Chapman Bartramus Bewyke & Johannes Rawe & omnes illi mer∣catores venturarii inhabitantes infra predict' vill' nostram & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam qui modo sunt de predicta societate predictor' mercatorum venturariorum in
predictis partibus Brabantie de cetero sint in re facto & nomine unum corpus incor∣poratum de se imperpetuum per nomen Gubernat' Assisten' & Gardianor' & Societatis Mercator' Venturarior' habitan' infra predictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam ac ipsos gubernator' assistentes & guardianos & societatem mercator' ven∣turarior' habitan' infra predict' vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam per pre∣sentes ex assensu predict' incorporamus stabilimus & unimus ac corpus incorporatum per nomen Gubernat' Assisten' Gardianor' & Societatis Mercator' Venturarior' habitan' infra predict' villam et com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam imperpetuum duratur' realiter & ad plenum creamus erigimus ordinamus facimus & constituimus per presentes et quod habeant successionem perpetuam Ac etiam volumus & pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris ex assensu predict' per presentes concedimus prefatis gubernatori assisten' gardianis & societati mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predict' villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam & successoribus fuis imperpetuum quod omne de eadem societate vel major pars ejusdem societatis pro tempore existen' qui tunc erunt infra predictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' de tempore in tempus imperpetuum annuatim nono die Octobris in aliquo loco convenienti infra predictam villam nostram Novi Castri super Tinam (viis mediis & modis quibus eis placuerit) nominabunt assignabunt & eligent ac nominare assignare & eligere possint & valeant imperpetuum unum de eadem societate pro tempore existen' fore gubernat' ejusdem societatis pro uno anno integro tunc sequen' ac duodecem de eadem societate pro tempore existen' fore assisten' gubernatori ejusdem societatis pro uno anno integro tunc sequen' ac duos de eadem societate pro tempore existen' fore gardianos ejusdem societatis pro uno anno integro tunc sequen' ac quod ille qui sic erit nominatus assig∣natus & electus per majorem partem ejusdem societatis (ad tunc & ibidem presentes) erit gubernator ejusdem societatis & geret officium gubernatoris ejusdem societatis pro uno anno integro ex tunc prox' sequen' que quidem persona sic eligen' & nominand' essend' gubernator societatis predicte prestabit corporale juramentum coram prox' pre∣decessore suo in eodem officio, si idem predecessor suus ad tunc superstes & presens fuerit in predicto loco et si predictus predecessor suus tunc defunct' vel absens fuerit tunc coram talibus assisten' vel eor' successor' qui tunc ibidem erunt presentes, pro fideli exercione & vero exercitio officii sui predict' Et ulterius volumus ac ex assensit predict' per presentes concedimus presatis gubernator' assisten' guardian' & societat' mer∣cator' venturarior' habitan' infra predict' villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam & successoribus suis imperpetuum, quod si contingat aliquum personam evistentem gubernat' societatis predicte obire dunante anno quo officium gubernat' societatis pre∣dicte geret vel gerere deberet vel ab eodem officio infra annum ex quacunque causa deprivari seu removeri, quod tunc, omnes assisten' residui ac alii de societate predicta, qui tunc erunt infra dictam vill' nostram & com' ville Noi Castri super Tinam, vel major pars eorundem de tempore in tempus, ad tale tempus, quale maiori parti eorundem assisten' & societat' (pro tempore existen') qui tunc infra villam nostram pre∣dict' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam erunt presentes, bonum & idoneum vide∣bitur in aliquo loco convenienti infra villam eandem viis modiis & modis quibus eis pla∣cuerit nominabunt & eligent ac nominare assignare & eligere possint & valeant unum de eadem societate pro tempore existen' fore gubernat' ejusdem societatis abinde, usque nonum diem Octobris post hujusmodi mortem deprivacionem sive remocionem prox' sequen' ac ille qui erit nominatus assignatus & electus per majorem partem ejusdem societatis, ad tunc ibidem presen', erit gubenator ejusdem societatis & geret officium gubernator' ejusdem societatis usque dictum nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' nisi interim ex causa rationabili removeri contigerit, que quidem persona sic electa & nominata essend' gubernator societat' predicte prestabit corporale juramentum
coram aliis de eadem societate ad tunc & ibidem presen' pro fideli exercitio officii sui predidti modo & forma supradictis Volumus etiam & pro nobis heredibus & succes∣soribus nostris per presentes ex assensu predicto concedimus prefatis gubernat' assisten' gardian' & societati mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam & successoribus suis imperpetuum, quod si contingat aliquem assisten' predictor' (pro tempore existen') infra annum illum obire deprivari vel ex quacunque causa ab officio suo removeri, quod tunc gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' ac omnes de numero assisten' ac de societate predicta, qui erunt pre∣sentes infra dictam vill' & com' ville predicte vel major pars eorundem de tempore in tempus ad tale tempus quale majori parti eorundem gubernatoris assisten' guardianor' & societatis pro tempore existen' qui tunc erunt infra dictam villam & com' ville predict' bonum & idoneum videbitur, in aliquo loco convenienti infra eandem villam viis & modis quibus eis placuerit nominabunt assignabunt ac eligent ac nominare assignare & eligere possint unum de dicta societate pro tempore existen' sore unum assisten' gubernator' ejusdem societatis pro tempore existen' in loco illius sic decedentis, de∣privari vel amoti existen' abinde usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' ac quod ille qui sic erit nominat' assign' & electus erit unus assisten' gubernat' ejus∣dem societatis pro tempore existen' usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' nisi ex causa rationabili ab officio illo interim deprivari seu removeri contigerit Volu∣mus etiam ac ex assensu predict' pro nobis heredibus & successoribus nostris per pre∣sentes concedimus prefatis gubernatori assistentibus gardianis & societat' mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam et suc∣cessoribus suis imperpetuum quod si contingat aliquem predictor' gardianor' societatis pro tempore existen' infra annum (quo electus fuerit ad deservien') obire vel ab officio suo deprivari seu ex quacunque causa removeri quod tunc gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' & omnes assisten' ac societas predict' vel eorundem major pars, ad tale tempus quale eis vel eorum majori parti tunc ibidem presen' videbitur oportu∣num in aliquo loco convenienti infra eandem vill' viis & modis quibus eis placuerit nominabunt assignabunt & eligent ac nominare assignare & eligere possint & valeant unum de dicta societate pro tempore existen' fore unum gardianor' ejusdem societatis, abinde usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' ac ille qui erit nominatus assignatus et electus erit unus gardianor' societat' predict' usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' nisi ex causa rationabili interim deprivari feur emoveri contigerit Volumus insuper et pro nobis heredibus et successoribus nostris ex assensu predicto per presentes concedimus prefatis gubernatori assisten' gardian's et societati mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam villam et com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam pre∣dict' et successoribus suis imperpetuum, quod gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' ac omnes de assisten' & societat' predict' qui tunc erunt presentes vel major pars eorundem totiens quotiens eis libuerit, admittent & facient, ac admittere & ordinare possint & valeant in dictam societatem mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predictam quemcunque seu quos∣cunque de subditis nostris seu de subdiiis heredum vel successorum nostror' habitan' seu habitant' aut habitand' vel habitandos infra predictam villam vel com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' que quidem persona vel persone sic admiss' vel admittend' fact' vel faciend' in eadem societate mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' erit durante vita sua, nisi ex causa rationa∣bili deprivari vel removeri contigerit, unum de eadem societate Volumus etiam et pro nobis heredibus et successoribus nostris ex assensu predict' per presentes concedimus prefatis gubernatori assistentibus gardianis et societati mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictum villam et com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam et successoribus suis imper∣petuum
quod gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' et omnes de assistentibus ac de societate predicta vel eor' major pars pro tempore existen' qui tunc erunt infra dictam villam & com' ville predicte ad tale tempus quale majori parti ejusdem socie∣tatis pro tempore existen' qui tunc erunt infra dictam villam Novi Castri super Tinam bonum &c idoneum videbitur in aliquo loco convenienti infra eandem villam viis & modis quibus eis placuerit admittere & facere possint & admittant & facient unum de subditis nostris vel de subditis heredum vel successor' nostror' fore clericum predicte societatis mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam vill' & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' ad exercendum officium clericatus ejusdem societatis quamdiu gubernatori ejusdem societatis assisten' gardianis & societati predictis pro tempore existen' vel eorum majori parti placuerit & non ultra Ac quod totiens & quotiens contingat aliquem clericum societatis predicte obire vel ab officio suo removeri unum alium idoneum de subditis nostris vel heredum aut successorum nostror' loco ipsius sic decedentis vel remoti existentis admittere & facere possint clericum predicte societatis mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra predictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam ad exercend' officium clericatus ejusdem societatis quamdiu gubernatori ejusdem societatis pro tempore existen' & majori parti eorundem existen' & societatis placuerit & non ultra Volumus etiam ac ex assensu predict' pro nobis heredibus & successor' nostris per presentes concedimus prefatis gubernatori assisten' gardianis & societati mer∣cator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam villam & com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predict' et successoribus suis, quod gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' assistentes gardiani et societatis predict' vel eorum major pars existens qui tunc erunt infra dictam vill' et com' ville predicte ad tale tempus quale eis congruum videbitur et oportunum in aliquo loco convenienti infra eandem villam viis et modis quibus eis placuerit nominare et eligere possint et valeant et nominabunt et eligent unam per∣sonam essend' bedellum societatis predicte usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' nisi interim decedere seu removeri contigerit pro summonicionibus et pre∣monicionibus hominum de societate predict' et aliis rebus officiis bedellatus pertinenti∣bus sive spectantibus pro societate predicta a tempore dicte electionis ejusdem bedelli usque dictum nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' faciend' et exequend' Et quod totiens quotiens contingat aliquem talem bedellum sic electum obire vel de officio suo privari seu removeri ante nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' dictam electionem suam quod tunc gubernator dicte societatis pro tempore existen' ac assistentes gardiani et societas vel eor' major pars pro tempore existen' qui tunc erunt infra dictam villam ad tale tempus quale eis congruum videbitur et oportunum in aliquo loco convenienti infra eandem villam viis et modis quibus eis placuerit nominare et eligere possint et nominabunt et eligent unam aliam personam de subditis nostris, essend' bedellum societatis predicte usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' nisi interim removeri contigerit pro sumonicionibus premonicionibus et aliis rebus officio bedellat' pertinen' sive spectan' pro societate predicta a dicto tempore electionis ejusdem bedelli usque nonum diem Octobris ex tunc prox' sequen' faciend' et exequend' & ulterius de uberiori gratia nostra ac ex certa scientia et mero motu nostris ac de avisamento et assensu predict' damus volumus et concedimus pro nobis heredibus et successoribus nostris prefatis gubernatori assisten' gardianis et societati mercator' venturarior' habitan' infra dictam villam et com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam predictam et successoribus suis imperpetuum quod iidem gubernator assistentes gardiani societas et successores sui imperpetutuum per nomen Gubernat' Assisten' Gardian' et Societat' Mercator' Venturarior' habitan' infra villam et com' ville Novi Castri super Tinam prosequi clamare placitare et placitari desendere et desendi possint et valeant in quibuscunque curiis et locis nostris heredum et successor' nostror' et quantum in nobis
