mannors, messuages, lands, tenements and hereditaments: and alsoe to doe and execute all and singular other actes and things whatsoever by the name aforesaid, and that by the name of Master, Pilotts and Seamen of the Trinitie House of Newcastle upon Tyne, in the countie of Newcastle upon Tyne, they shall and may be able to plead and be impleaded, to answer and to be answered unto, to defend and be defended, in whatsoever courtes and places and before ainie judge and justices or other persons or officers of us, our heirs and successors whatsoever, in all and singular actions, pleas, suites, plaintes and demands, of whatsoever kinde, qualitie or nature they shall be, in the same maner and forme as anie other our liege subjects of this our realme of Eng∣land, being persons able and capable in lawe, or anie other bodie corporate and pollitique within this our realme of England can or may have, purchase, receive, enjoy, retaine, give, grant, lett, aliene, assigne and dispose, plead or be impleaded, answer and be answered unto, defend and be defended, do permitt or execute. And we do also by these presents constitute and ordeine Martin Errington, now one of the Companie, M. B. and Societie of Shipmasters, Pilotts and Seamen within the said towne and porte of Newcastle upon Tyne, from henceforth to be Master of the said Companie, M. B. and Societie; and that Edward Beard, Robert Chambers, Richard Rawe, John Johnson, William Mitcheson, John Howburne, Bartram Simpson, Edwarde Browne, Thomas Lindsey, William Mawe, Reignold Gibson, and Robert Nicholson, now being of the Companie, M. B. & S. of Shipmasters, Pilotts and Seamen of the said towne and porte of Newcastle upon Tyne, shall from henceforth be and be called Elder Brothers of the said Companie, M. B. & S. And that William Stephenson, William Hindmers, Henrie Knowelis, Lyonell Armestrong, William Maltland, William Watkinson, John Baxter, John Robson, Robert Rawe, John Pattenson, William Cooke, Henrie Cleburne, John Cleborne, and all other of the C. M. B. & S. of Shipmasters, Pilotts and Seamen, within the said towne and porte of Newcastle upon Tyne, shall from henceforth be and be called Younger Brothers of the saide Companie, M. B. and Societie. And that two of the said Elder Brothers, that is to say, Robert Chambers and Robert Nicholson, shall from henceforth be and be called Elder Wardens of the said C. M. B. & S. And that two of the said Elder Brothers, that is to say, Richard Rawe and Edward Browne, shall from henceforth be and be called Assistants unto the said elder Wardens. And that other two of the said younger Brothers, that is to say, William Maltland and William Watkinson, than from henceforth be and he called Younger Wardens of the said C. M. B. & S. And that other two of the said Younger Brothers, that is to say, Edward Pearson and John Pattenson, shall from henceforth be and be called Assistants unto the said younger Wardens. All which persons to nomi∣nated, placed and appointed in their severall offices, places and functions, shall so con∣tinue in their said severall offices, places and functions, untill from thence they shall be severalli removed, expelled or discharged, or others of the said C. M. B. & Societie in their several roomes and places elected and chosen, in maner as in these presents shall be hereafter expressed. And we do further for the considerations aforesaid, and of our certain knowledge, mere motion, and speciall grace, for us, our heires and suc∣cessors, grant unto the said M. P. and Seamen, and their successors, that it shall and may be lawfull for them and their successors, yearelie and from tyme to tyme att their pleasures, and often as itt shall seme unto them or the moste parte of them to be expedient, to assemble and mete together at a certen house called the Trinitie House, scituate and being in the said towne and countie of Newcastle upon Tyne, and then and there by their generall consent or the most voices of the said whole Companie, M. B. & S. as well of elder Brothers as of younger Brother, then and there being present, to elect and chuse twelve persons of said whole Companie, M. B. & S. as well of elder Brothers as of younger Brothers, whereof 6 at least to be the elder
Brothers, if they be then and there present, and in supplie of such elder Brothers want∣ing, then the residue to be taken of the younger Brothers then and there present; which twelve persons so by them elected and chosen shall for that tyme have full and absolute powre and authoritie from their severall offices, functions and places not onely to remove, expell and discharge the said Maister, elder Wardens and younger Wardens, or any of them herein appointed, or hereafter in manner and forme followinge to be nominated, elected, and appointed. And likewise the said Assistants as well unto the said elder Wardens as younger Wardens herein appointed, or hereafter in manner and forme following to be nominated, elected and appointed, or any of the said elder Wardens or younger Wardens or Assistants unto the said elder Wardens and younger Wardens herein appointed, or hereafter in manner and forme following to be elected, nominated and appointed; but also in their names, places and steads, or in the names, places and steads of them or any of them so removed, expelled, putt out, or otherwise dyscharged, to nominate, elect and substitute the same person or persons so removed, putt forth or discharged, or any other person or persons of the said Comp. M. B. & S. in maner and forme following, that is to say, out of the said whole Comp. M. B. & S. of the said elder Brothers, hereby constituted and ordeined, or by the said C. M. B. & Societie att any tyme or tymes hereafter to be elected, nominated and appointed, one Maister, two elder Wardens, and two Assistants unto the said elder Wardens, and out of the said Companie of younger Brothers two younger Wardens, and two Assistants unto the said younger Wardens. And that itt shall be lawfull for the said Maister, Wardens and Assistants so newlie elected, and the aforesaid 12 persons, being electors as aforesaid, or the moste parte of them, then and there present, to elect, nominate, constitute and appoint such other officer or officers, servant or servants, for and con∣cerning the necessary expedition of the businesse and other occasions of the said C. M. B. & Societie, as shall be expedient, serviceable and convenient for the same: and likewise to admitt into their said Companie, M. B. & Society, such other Shipmaisters, P. & Seamen, being free burgesses of the said towne of Newcastle upon Tyne, from tyme to tyme, and as often as shall seeme expedient to them. And alsoe we grant for us, our heirs and successors, unto the said Maister, Pilotts and Seamen, and their successors, that they the said M. P. & S. and their successors, may make and cause to be made for themselves one common seale for the expedition of their businesse, causes and affaires, that may he, appertaine and belong to the said Companie, M. B. & S. and the same seale att all tyme and tymes to alter and change att their will and plea∣sures. And we do further of our certain knowledge, mere motion and special grace grant for us, and our heires, unto the said Maister, P. & S. and their successors for ever, that the said M. B. & Seamen, and their successors, from tyme to tyme, and as often as shall be expedient, may meete and assemble togither att the said Trinitie House, to confer, treate, common, agree and conclude amongst themselves. of, for and concern∣ing the conservation, good estate and good government of the said Company, M. B. & Societie, and for reporting or ending of such matters and controversies as shall be lawfullie and by authoritie referred or submitted unto them, touching anie person or presons in marine and sea causes onlie, concerning the marine knowledge and science of seamen, that shall happen from tyme to tyme to resorte to the river of Tyne, the creeks and members of the same, that is to say, Blithe, Sunderland, Hartlepoole, Whitby and Staithes, and all other creeks and members belonging to the said porte of Newcastle upon Tyne. And further wee will and grant for us, our heires and suc∣cessors, that they the said Maister, P. & Seamen, so lawfullie mett and assembled toge∣ther in the said Trinitie House, whereof the Maister, one of the elder Wardens, and one of the younger Wardens, or in the absence of such Wardens one of the elderAssistants, or one of the younger Assistants, respectivelie shall be three, shall have full power
and authoritie from tyme to tyme to constitute, establish and make decrees, lawes, constitutions and ordinances for the good estate, conservation and wholsome govern∣ment to be hadd amongst themselves, and for the good direction and incouragement of such seamen and mariners as shall resorte from tyme to tyme to the said porte and towne of Newcastle, creeks and members aforesaid so belonging to the said porte and towne of Newcastle, touching marine and sea causes onelie. And further we grant for us, our heirs and successors, unto the said Maister, P. & S. and their successors, full power and authoritie that whatsoever so shall be reasonablie and lawfully concluded and agreed upon att anie such lawfull assemblie or meeting of the said M. P. & S. touching the causes aforesaid, that the same shall be kept and observed by and amongst the said C. M. B. & S. and all whom the same shall concerne. And whatsoever of the said C. M. B. & S. shall offend against the said decrees, orders, lawes, and ordinances, or any of them, it shall be lawfull unto the said Maister, P. and S. or the greatest number of them so lawfully assembled togither (whereof the Maister for the tyme being, one of the elder Wardens, and one of the younger Wardens, or, in the absence of the said Wardens, one of the elder Assistants, or one of the younger Assistants, respectively shall be three) in their discretions in reason and equitie, having consideration to the quantitie and qualitie of the fault, to punish and correct by paines, penalties, and amerciaments, to be reasonablie inflicted upon such offenders; and the said paines, penalties and amerciaments so inflicted and imposed, to levie, take, and to convert to the use of the said Companie, M. B. and S. And that like∣wise it shall be lawfull for the said M. P. and S. from tyme to tyme, and as often as they shall think mete and convenient, to revoke, disannull, supplie, alter or change any act or acts, decrees, orders, lawes and ordinances so by them lawfullie made, or here∣after to he made so alwaies as the said decrees, orders, lawes, constitutions, ordi∣nances, paines, penalties and amerciaments be reasonable, and not repugnant, nor contrarie to the lawes, statutes, customes and right of this our realm of England, nor the liberties, franchises, priveleges, customes, prescriptions, charters or grants of the said towne of Newcastle. And we do further of our like special grace, certaine know∣ledge, and mere motion, grant for us, our heires and successors unto the said M. P. and S. and their successors for ever, that itt shall and may be lawfull for them, or for the said Maister, or one of the said elder Wardens, and one of the said younger Wardens, and for want of such, they being absent, then for any three of the most auncient of the said Comp. M. B. and Societie being present at home, and their successors from tyme to tyme, to nominate and appoint sufficient and skilfull pilott or pilotts for the bringing upp and carying downe the river of Tyne, and in and out of all or any other the creeks and members before named, belonging to the said towne or porte of Newcastle upon Tyne, all shipps or vessells, whereof the owner or part owner, or purser shall be desirous or willing to have a pilott for conducting such shipps or vessells upp or downe the said river of Tine, or in or out of any the creeks or members of the same, unlesse such owner, part owner, maister or purser shall make speciall or other choice of any other of the said Comp. M. B. and S. then present at home. And that such pilott or pilotts so to be nominated and appointed, or speciallie chosen as aforesaid, shall art all tyme and tymes within the said river of Tine, and in and outh of all and every the creeks and members of the same to the said porte, have the pilorshipp, conducting and bringing upp and carrying, downe, and in and out, of all such shipps and vessells as aforesaid. And that no other person or persons, whatsoever shall deale or intermeddle therein: And that for their labors and pas hereafter to be sustained and taken in the bringing upp and carrying downe any shipps or vessells within the river of Tine, and in and out the creeks and members aforesaid, it shall and may be lawfull for the said M. P. and Seamen, or for such of them as shall be so appointed, nominated or chosen
as aforesaid, and for their Ministers or Officers, Minister or Officer, in this behalf to be employed, to demand, receive, perceive and take of the owner, part owner, maister, purser or factor of every shipp or vessell so by them or any of them to be conducted as aforesaid, being laden, for everie foote, which such shipp or vessell, so by them to be conducted and laden, shall drawe, twelve pence of lawful money of England, and for everie foote which such shipp or vessell, as shall be light, being so conducted, shall drawe, 8d. as formerlie the said Companie, M. B. and S. have usuallie and lawfullie taken. And furthermore of our like abundant grace, certen knowledge, and mere motion, we for us, our heires and successors, have given and granted, and by these presents do give and grant unto the said M. P. and S. and their successors, that all person and persons, as well subjects as strangers borne, being owner or owners of any goods, wayres, comodities, or merchandizes, which than at any time or tymes here∣after be brought in any shipp or vessells from beyond the seas into the said river of Tine, or the creeks or members aforesaid, or any other creeks or members belonging to the said porte of N. C. upon Tyne, shall from tyme to tyme and as often as such goods, wayres, comodities or merchandizes shall be so brought in, paye or cause to be paid unto the said M. P. and S. and their successors or Officers, or Minister in that behalf appointed for the tyme being, an ancient duetie heretofore lawfullie, accustamablie and usually paid to the said C. M. B. and S. called Primage, that is to say, 2d. of everie tunn of wine, oile, and other goods, wares, merchandizes and comodities rated and accompted by the tunn (fish killed and brought in by Englishmen onelie excepted), and 3d. for every laste of flaxe, hemp, pitch, tarr, or any other goodes or raffe wares, merchandizes and comodities whatsoever, rated and accompted by the last in manner and form following, that is to say, aliens and straungers borne, and all other such person or persons, which with their said shipps or vessells shall arrive in the said porte, or in any of the said creeks and members, and not belonging to the same, before they depart with their said shipps or vessels from the said porte, or forth of the said creeks, shall paye the duties aforesaid, for and in the name of Primage as is aforesaide. And everie free merchant and other inhabitant of Newcastle aforesaid arriving with their said shipps, or other vessells, within the said river of Tyne, shall pay the duties aforesaid within ten dayes after the landing of the said goods as aforesaid, upon lawful demand by the said Maister, Pilotts and Seamen, or their Officers and Minister by them to be appointed. Which said duetie called Primage, and whatsoever somes hereafter shall so accrue unto the said Maister, Pilotts and Seamen, and their successors, or other∣wise shall arise and happen unto them by fines, forfeitures or amerciaments amongst themselves, or otherwise howsoever shall be to the onelie use, commoditie and profitt of the Maister, P and Seamen, and their successors for the repayring of the said house or hall, called the Trinitie House, and for the finding of twelve poore persons of the said Companie, M. B. and S. or their wives, which are or shall hereafter fall into povertie. And alsoe for relief and succour of other poor mariners and seamen having suffered shipwreck, or otherwise distressed, and such as by them and their suceessors shall be thought mete and necessarie therewith to be relieved, according to charitie, as they have formerly used, without any accompt, or any thing therfor, to us, our heires and successors, to be yielded, paid and done, and without any lawfull molestation or trouble of any other person or persons whatsoever for or concerning the same. And furthermore we, of like special grace, certen knowledge and mere motion, have given and granted, and by there presents do for us, our heirs and successots, give and grant unto the said M. P. & S. and their successors, that they, by their Officers of Mu is to be appointed as aforesaid from tyme to tyme for ever, shall and may from hence∣forth have, levie, receive, collect and take for and towards the charges of repairing and orderly removing and keeping of those two houses, called the Light Houses art the
North Sheiles, heretofore builded, kept and maintained by the aforesaid C. M. B. & S. for marks, for the entering of the said haven of Tinmouth, and for lights to be kept in them in the night tyme from quarter and half quarter flood to half ebb, an ancient, lawfull and accustomed duetie called Lightage, that is to say, of every English shipp or other vessell entring within the said haven, or any the creeks or members of them, them, whereof any Englishman borne shall be owner, 4d. current English money, for every tyme that any such shipp or vessell shall enter or come within the said haven, or any the creeks or members of the same. And also to take of every ship or vessell, whereof any stranger not borne within this realme is or shall be owner, 12d. of every such shipp or vessell for every tyme so entering the same haven, or any of the creeks or members of the same, as heretofore hath bene accustomed to be lawfullie paid and re∣ceived towards the maintenance of the mark, and lights aforesaid. And further of our like aboundant grace, certen knowledge and mere motion, we for us, our heirs and successors, do constitute and appointe the said M. P. & S. and their successors, that they by themselves or their sufficient Officers or Minister in that behalf to be appointed for the more better and safe conducting of vessells going upp or coming down the said river of Tine, or coming in or going forth of any of the creeks and members thereof as aforesaid, shall from henceforth att all tyme and tymes hereafter, have as formerlie they have accustomably had the appointing, setting, limiting, boying, canningBoyage, Cannage., marking and beaconing of the said river of Tine, and the renewing, repairing and re∣moving of the same as occasion shall require. And that the said M. P. and S. and their successors and assignes, for and towards the charges of the same from tyme to tyme hereafter, shall have, perceive, collect and take of every shipp or vessell, whereof anie Englishman borne is or shall be owner, being in burthen above twenty chalders of coles, and coming into the said river of Tine, or any of the said creeks or members, as for∣merly he hath bene accustomably and lawfully taken 4d. of lawful money of England; and of every shipp or vessell being under twenty chalders, whereof any Englishman borne is or shall be owner, and comeing into the said river of Tine, or any of the said creeks or members as formerly, hath bene taken 2d. of like lawful money of England. And of every shipp or vessell entering into the said haven, or any of the creeks or mem∣bers aforesaid, whereof any alien borne is or shall be owner, as formerly hath ac∣customably beene taken 6d. of like lawful money of England. And further of our like certaine knowledge, special grace and mere motion for us, our heires and successors, we grant and confirm unto the said M. P. & S. and their successor, the said house called Trinitie House with th' appurtenances, and all other lands, tenements, here∣ditaments, priveledges, perquisits, auncient duties and profitts which the said C. M. B. & S. have heretofore lawfully hadd and enjoyed, or whereof they or any of them, or any other, to and for their uses have heretofore been lawfully seized or possessed, and which the said C. M. B. & S. at the tyme of this our grant do lawfully percive, have, hould and enjoy. And we further grant for us, our heires and successors, that it shall be lawfull to any persons whatsoever hereafter to give, devise, assigne, or convey unto the said M. P. & Seamen, and their successors, anie lands, tenements, services or here∣ditaments, being houlden of us or any of our subjects in socaige onlie, or in the nature of scaige tenure, so that the same lands, tenements, services and hereditaments do not exceed the clear yearlie value of 30l. by the yeare. And that the said M. P. & S. and their successors may according take the same to them and their successors, by the gt, devise, of conveyance of any person or persons as aforesaid whatsoever. And our pleasure is, that these our letters patents shall be good and effectual in the lawe ntents, respects and purposes unto the said M. P. & Seamen, and
their successors, without suing any writt or writts of ad quod damnum, the statute of mortmain, or any other statute, act, ordinance, proclamation, provision or restrainte thereof heretofore hadd, made, sett forth, ordeined or provided, or any other thing, cause, or matter whatsoever to the contrarie notwithstanding; although expresse mention of the true yearlie value or certainty of the premisses, or any of them, or of any other guists or graunts by us or any of our progenitors or predecessors to the aforesaid M. P. & Seamen heretofore made in these presents is not made, nor any statute, act, ordinance, provision, proclamation or restraint to the contrarie hereof had, made, ordeined or provided, or any other thing, cause or matter, whatsoever itt be, in any wise notwithstanding. In witness whereof we have caused these our lettres to be made pattents. Witnes ourself at Westminster the 18th day of Januarie, in the 3d yeare of our raigne of England, Fraunce and Ireland, and of Scotland the 39th.

CLOSER.SIGNED: Per breve de privato sigillo. LUKYN.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 330. TRINITY-HOUSE.
DIV2.P:
CHARLES the Second by the grace of God King of England Scotland France and Ireland Defender of the Faith &c. to all to whome these presents shall come greeting Know yee that we at the humble petition of the company mystry brother∣hood and society of shipmasters pylots and seamen within the town and port of New∣castle upon Tyne in the county of the same town of Newcastle upon Tyne as well for the better increasing and for the maintenance of our navigation for the benefitt defence and preservacion of our realm as also for the better government rule and order of them and every of them and of our speciale grace certain knowledge and mere motion have willed ordained constituted granted and confirmed and by these presents for us our heirs and successors doth will ordain constitute declare grant and confirm that all and singular the shipmasters pylots and seamen of the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne and all the men of the said company mystery brotherhood and society dwelling or inhabiting within the said town of Newcastle upon Tyne for ever hereafter for the better govern∣ment rule and order of them and for the profitt comodity and reliefe of the good and honest men and for the sear and terror of evile and wicked offenders be and shall b by virtue of these presents one body corporate and politique in deed and name by the name of Master Pylotts and Seamen of the Trinity-house of Newcastle upon Tine in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne and them by the name of the Master Pylotts and Seamen of the Trinity-house in Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne we do by these presents for us our heirs and successors really and fully create make ordame constitute declare and confirm one body politique in deed and name and that by the same name they may have perpetuall succession and that they and their sucessors by the name of Master Pylotts and Seamen of the Trinity-houser of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne shall be ever hereafter persons able and
capable in the law to purchase take receive and enjoy lands tenements rents ser∣vices and other possessions and hereditaments whatsoever to them and their successors for ever in see or perpetuity or for term of lives years or otherwise in what sort soever and also all manner of goods chattels and things whatsoever of what name nature or quality soever they be and also to give grant alien assigne and dispose of manors messuages lands tenements hereditaments and also to do and execute all and singular other acts and things whatsoever by the name aforesaid and that by the name of Master Pylots and Seamen of the town of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne they shall and may be able to plead and to be impleaded to answer and be answered unto to defend and be defended in whatsoever court and places and before any judge and justices or any other officer or officers of us our heirs and successors whatsoever in all and singular accions pleas suits plaints matters and demands of what kind quality or nature they shall he in the same manner and form as any other our leige subjects of this our realm of England being persons able and capable in the law or any other body corporate and politique within this our realm of England can or may have purchase receive possess enjoy retain give grant let aliene assigne and dispose plead and be impleaded answer and be answered unto defend and be defended do permitt or execute And we do also by these presents constitute and ordain Captain Edward Nixon one of the Company Mistery Brotherhood and Society of Shipmasters Pylotts and Seamen within the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne from henceforth to be Master of the said Company Mistery Brotherhood and Society And that James Denton Richard Elbrough Henry Bird Ralph Fell John Simpson Thomas Auebony Cuth. Atkinson Rowland Pithie Henry Kirkhouse George Shaftoe George Swaddell and Thomas Dixon now being of the Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society of Shipmasters Pylotts and Seamen of the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from henceforth be and be called Elder Brothers of the said Company Mistery Brotherhood and Society And that Robert Cook John Patridge Abraham Readhead James Bray Matth. Henderson Anth. Hodgson Tho. Simpson Abraham Dixon John Otway James Brankston Wm. Tickett Matth. Baites James Rand Richard Fell Mich. Elbrough Wm. Wreight Timothy Lowins Henry Hewerdene Mich. Shaw Robt. Rand John Bee Thomas Green and all other of the Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society of Shipmasters Pylotts and Stamen within the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from henceforth he and be called Younger Brothers of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society And that two of the said elder Brothers (that is to say) Ralph Fell and Henry Kirkhouse shall from henceforth be and be called Elder Wardens of the said Company Mystery Brother∣hood and Society And that two of the said elder Brothers (that is to say) George Shaftoe and George Swaddell shall from henceforth be and be called Assistants unto the said elder Wardens And that other two of the said younger Brethren (that is to say) Abraham Dixon and John Bee shall from henceforth he and be called Younger Wardens of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society And that two other of the said younger Brothers (that is to say) Richard Fell and Thomas Green shall from henceforth he and he called Assistants unto the said younger Wardens All which per∣sons nominated placed and appointed in then several offices places and functions shall so continue in their said several offices places and functions until from thence they shall be severally removed expelled or discharged and other of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society in their several rooms and places shall be elected and chosen in manner as in these presents shall hereafter be expressed And we do further for the con∣siderations aforesaid and of our certain knowledge mere mocion and especial grace for us our heirs and successors grant and confrim unto the said Master Pylotts and Seamen and their successors that it shall and may be lawfull for them and their successors yearly and from time to time at their pleasures and as often as it shall seem unto them or the
most of them to be expedient to assemble and meet together at a certain house called the Trinity House scituate and being in the said town and county of Newcastle upon Tyne and then and there by their generall consent or most voices of the said whole Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society as well of elder Brothers as younger Brothers then and there being present to elect and chuse twelve persons of the said whole Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society as well the elder Brohers as younger Brothers whereof six at least to be of the elder Brothers if they be then and there present and in supply of such elder Brothers wanting then the residue to be taken out of the younger Brothers then and there present Which twelve persons so by them elected and chosen shall for that time have full and absolute power and authority from their several offices functions and places not only to remove expell and discharge the said Master elder Wardens and younger Wardens or any of them herein appointed or hereafter in manner and form following to be nominated elected and appointed and likewise the said Assistants as well unto the said elder Wardens as younger Wardens herein appointed or hereafter in manner and form following to be elected nominated and appointed or any of the said elder Wardens or younger Wardens or Assistants unto the said elder Wardens or younger Wardens herein appointed or hereafter in manner and form following to be elected nominated and appointed but also in their names places and steads or in the names places or steads of them or any of them so removed expelled put out or otherwise discharged to nominate elect and substitute the same per∣son or persons so removed put forth or discharged or any other person or persons of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society in manner and form following (that is to say) out of the said whole Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society of the said elder Brothers hereby constituted and ordained or by the said Company Mystery Bro∣therhood and Society at any time or times hereafter to be elected nominated or ap∣pointed one Master two elder Wardens and two Assistants unto the said elder Wardens and out of the said Company of younger Brothers two younger Wardens and two Assistants unto the said younger Wardens And that it shall be lawfull for the said Master Wardens and Assistants so newly elected and the aforesaid twelve persons being elected as aforesaid or the moste part of them then and there present to elect nominate con∣stitute and appoint such other officer or officers servant or servants for and concerning the necessary expedicion of the business and other occasions of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society as shall be expedient serviceable and convenient for the same And likewise to admitt into the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society such other Shipmasters Pylotts and Seamen being free burgesses of the said town of Newcastle upon Tyne from time to time and as often as shall sees expedient unto them And also we grant for us our heirs and successors unto the said Master Pylotts and Seamen and their successors that they said Masters Pyllots and Seamen and their successors may make or cause to be made for themselves one comon seal for the expedicion of their business causes and affairs that may be appertain and belong to the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society and the same seal at all time and times to alter and change at their wills and pleasures And we do fur∣ther of our certain knowledge mere motion and special grace grant for us our heirs and successors unto the said Master Pylotts and Seamen and their successors for ever that the said Master Pylotts and Seamen and their successors from time to time and as often as shall be expedient may meet and assemble together at the said Trynyty House to confer treat commune agree and conclude among themselves of for and concerning the conservacion good estate and good government of the said Company Mystery Brother∣hood and Society and for reporting or ending such matters and controversies as shall be lawfully and by authority referred or submitted to them touching any person or persons in marine and sea causes only touching the cunning knowledge or service of seamen that shall happen from time to time to resort to the river of Tyne the crecks and members of the
same (that is to say) Blyth Sunderland Hartlepoole Whiting and Stathes and all other creeks and members belonging to the said port of Newcastle upon Tyne. And further we will and grant for us our heirs and successor at they the said Master Pylotts and Seamen or the greatest number of them do lavish meet and assemble together in the said Trinity House whereof the said Master one of the older Wardens and one of the younger Wardens or in the absence of such Wardens of the elder Assistants or one of the younger Assistants respectively shall be there power and authority from time to time to constitute establish and make decrees law constitucions and ordinances for the good estate conservacion and wholesome gown to be had amongst themserlves and for the good direccion and encourigement of such seamen and mariners as shall resort from time to time to the said port of the town of Newcastle creeks and members afore∣said so belonging to the said port and town of Newcastle touching marine and sea causes only And further we grant for us our heirs and sucecssors unto the said Master Pylotts and Seamen and their successors full power and authoritv that whatsoever shall be rea∣sonably and lawfully concluded and agreed upon at any such lawfull assembly or meeting of the said Master Pylotts and Seamen touching the causes aforesaid that the same shall be kept and observed by and amongst the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society and all others whom the same shall concern and whosoever of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood or Society shall offend against the said decree orders laws and ordinances or any of them it shall be lawfull unto the said Master Pylotts and Seamen or the greatest number of them so lawfully assembled together whereof the Master for the time being one of the elder Wardens one of the younger Wardens or in the absence of the said Wardens one of the elder Assistants or one of the younger Assistants respec∣tively shall be three at their discressions in reason and equity having consideration unto the quality and quantity of the fault to punish and correct by pains penaltyes and amerce∣ments to be reasonably inflickted upon such offenders and the said pains penaltyes and amercements so inflickted and imposed to levy take and convert to the use of the said Company Mystery Brotherhood and Society And that likewise it shall be lawfull for the said Master Pylotts and Seamen from time to time and as often as they fall think meet and convenient to revoke until supply alter change article or articles decrees orders laws and ordinannes so by then lawfully make or hereafter to be made so alvvays as the said decrees orders laws constitucions of and amercements be reasonable and not repugnant for the lw customes and rights of this our realm of England for the ledges customes prescriptions charter or grants of the said of Newcastel. And we do further of our like speciall grace certain knowledge and for us our heirs and successors unto the said Master Pylott and successors for ever that it shall and may be lawfull for them of forth said elder Wardens and one of tlie said y W or then for any three of the most ancient of the said Society being present at home and and appoint sufficier and shilful down the river Tyne and in and out of named belonging to the said town whereof the owner or part owner pytott for conducting or out of any of the creek master or pur shall in mastery brotherhood adn so to be nominated and appointed or times within the said of Tyne and in and
members belonging to the said port have the pylottship conducting bringing up and carrying down and in and out of all such ships and vessells as aforesaid and that no other person or persons whatsoever shall deal or intermeddle therein And whereas we have been informed that by the frequent and dangerous incursions of the sea upon the said port of Newcastle the said society are put to necessary and extraordinary charges for prevencion and repair of the ruins thereby daly growing; therefore we are willing for their better assistance therein yt for the future they may receive an addicion to the former payment and allowances in that behalf Our will and pleasure therefore is and we do hereby for us our heirs and successors declare and grant unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors that it shall and may be lawfull to and for the said master pylotts and seamen and for such of them as shall be so appointed nominated or chosen as aforesaid and for their ministers and officers minister or officer in this behalf so to be employed to demand receive procure and take of the owner part owner master purser or factor of every ship or vessell so by them or any of them to be conducled as aforesaid being laden for every foot whieh such ships or vessells (so by them to be conducted and laden) shall draw twelve pence of lawfull money of England as hath been usually receivcd and taken by the said company and also the sume of six pence more of like money of all strangers and aliens only over and besides the said twelve pence in this behalf formerly paid and for every foot which such ships or vessells which shall be light being so conducted shall draw eight pence as formerly the said company have usually taken and also the sume of four pence more of like money of aliens or strangers only, over and beside the said eight pence in this behalf formerly received And furthermore of our like abundant grace certain knowledge and mere mocion we for us our heirs and successors have given granted and confirmed and by these presents do give grant and confirm unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors that all person and persons as well subjects as strangers born being owner or owners of any goods wares comodityes or merchandizes which shall at any time or times hereafter be brought in any ship or vessell from beyond the seas into the said river of Tyne or the creeks or members aforesaid or any creek or member belonging to the said port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from time to time and as often as such goods wares comodityes or merchandizes shall be so brought in, pay or cause to be paid unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors or their officers or ministers in that behalf appointed for the time being an ancient duty heretofore lawfully accustomably and usually paid to the said company mystery brotherhood and sociery called primage (that is to say) two pence of every tonne of wine and oyle and all other goods wares merchandizes and comodityes rated and appointed by the tonn (fish killed and brought in by the Englishmen only excepted) and threepence for every last of slax hemp pitch tarr or any other goods raff wares merchandizes and comodityes whatsoever rated and accoumpted by the last in manner and form following (that is to say) aliens and strangers born and all other such person or persons which with their said ships or vessells shall arrive within the said port or any of the said creeks or members and not belonging to the same before they depart with their said ships or vessells from the said port or forth of the said creeks shall pay the dutyes aforesaid for and in the manner of the primage as is aforesaid and every free mer∣chant and other inhabitant of Newcastle aforesaid arriving with their said ships or vessells within the said river of Tyne shall pay the dutyes aforesaid within ten days after the landing of the said goods as aforesaid upon lawful demand by the said master pylotts and seamen and their officers or ministers by them to be appointed which said duty called primage and whatsoever summe and summes hereafter shall so accrew unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors or otherwise shall arise and happen unto them by fines forfeitures or amercements amongst themselves or otherwise how∣soever, shall be to the only use comodity and profitt of the said master pylotts and
seamen and their successors for the reparcing of the said house or hall called Trinity House and for the finding of twelve poor persons of the said company mystery brotherhood and society or their wives vvhich are or shall hereafter fall into poverty and also for reliefe and succour of other our marriners and seamen haveing suffered shipwrack or otherwise distressed and such as by them and their successors shall be thought meet and necessary therewith to be relieved according to the charity as they have formerly used without any account or any thing therefore to us our heirs and successors to be yielded paid and dope and without any lawfull molestacion or trouble of any other person or persons whatsoever for and concerning the same And furthermore we of our like special grace certain knowledge and mere mocion have given and granted and by these presents do for us our heirs and successors give and grant unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors that they by their officers or ministers to be appointed as aforesaid from time to time for ever shall and may from henceforth levy have receive collect and take for and towards the charges and repairing and orderly removing and keeping of those two houses called the Light-houses at North Sheilds heretofore builded kept and maintained by the said company mystery brotherhood and society for marks for the entring of the said haven of Tynemouth and for lights to be kept in them for the night time from quarter and half quarter flood to half ebb the several dutyes following (that is to say) of every English ship or vessell entering within the said haven or any the creeks or members of the same whereof an Englishman born shall be owner six pence current English money for every time that any such ship or vessell shall enter or come within the said haven or any of the said creeks or members of the same And also to take of every ship or vessell whereof any stranger not born within the realm is or shall be owner fourteen pence of every such ship or vessell for every time so entering the said haven or any of the creeks or members of the same towards the maintenance of the markes or leights as aforesaid And further of our like abundant grace certain knowledge and meer mocion we for us our heirs and successors do constitute and appoint the said master pylotts and seamen their successors or assignes that they by themselves or their sufficient officers or ministers in that behalf to be appointed for the more better and safe conducting of vessells going up and coming down the said river of Tyne and comeing in or going forth of any the creeks or members thereof as aforesaid shall from henceforth at all time and times here∣after have as formerly they have accustomably had the appointing setting limitting boaying canning marking and beaconing of the said river of Tyne and renewing reparing and removing the same as occasion shall require And that the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors and assignes for and towards the charges of the same from time to time hereafter shall have perceive collect and take of every ship or vessell whereof any Englishman born is or shall be owner being in burthen above twenty chalders of coles and coming into the said river of Tyne or any of the said creeks or members six pence of lawfull money of England and of every ship or vessell being under twenty chalders of coles whereof an Englishman born is or shall be owner and coming into the said river of Tyne or any of the said creeks or members four pence of like lawfull money of England and of every ship or vessell entring into the said haven or any the creeks or members aforesaid whereof any alien born is or shall be owner eight pence ot like lawfull money of England And for as much as the said master pylotts and seamen being oftentimes in themselves and their servants and ships to be charged and imployed at one hour's warning in out service at sea in and for the good and necessary defence of our realms and kingdoms cannot give their due attendance therein with such diligence as their duty was and is to do by reason that they be many times compelled to bear arms or to contribute unto the charge thereof for land service as also to serve upon inquests and juries at assizes session court leets court barrons before
the coroner and in other courts commicions and places of jurisdiccion to the great vexacion and burthen to the said corporacion and to the perill of the said service at sea by reason they cannot convenientry attend both the one and the other Therefore we of our more abundant grace certain knowledge and meer mocion do will and grant and by these presents for us our heirs and successors that they and every of them and all and every other brother and minister of the same being marrines and seafairing men and their and every of their servants and apprentices that now be or at any time or times hereafter shall be their successors and the successors of every of them from time to time and at all times from henceforth shall be discharged and exempted from the bearing or finding of any armour to or for any land service at or upon general master or other view to be taken of armour in any of the countys or places where they or any of them shall make their abode or dwelling at the time of the said muster or view taken and from being or contributeing to the setting forth of any soldiers to be employed or sent forth to or for land service other than as marriners and seamen in sea service and also that they and every of them shall be in like manner discharged and exempted from being sumoned and put in assizes juryes inquests inquisitions attaints and other recog∣nizances taken or sumoned within the said countyes or places or any of them unless that they the said master pylotts and seamen and other seamen and marriners aforesaid be thereto compelled or compellable by reason of his or their tenures or unless it be for our service at everv Admiralty Sessions which they and every of them shall be always tyed and bound to attend upon their perill and being thereinto lawfully sumoned as hereafter And moreover that they and every of them shall be likewise discharged and exempted from being otherwise taxed to for or with any manner of land service whatsoever (other than as aforesaid) or to be contributary And that if at any time or times hereafter the said master pylotts and seamen or any of them or any other brother officer minister or member of the said corporacion for the time being by any ways or means be appointed for bearing or finding of armour or taxed to or with any manner of land service other than as is aforesaid or to be contributary to the same or sumoned or put in assizes jury's inquests inquisitions or other recognizances other than as is aforesaid taken or sumoned within the said countyes jurisdiccions or places where they or any of them shall remain er abide other than as in regard of their said tenures or for our service at or in the admirality of assizes or sessions as aforesaid that then the said appointment or sumons and also the said taxacion to be utterly void and of none effect any order custome law or usage to the contrary before this time had or used in any of the said countyes jurisdiccions or places notwithstanding Provided always that if the lords and others of the privy councell of us our heirs or successors or any six or more of them (whereof the lord admirall for the time being to be always one) signed with the hands of them or any six or more of them to be contributary to the charge of any armour munition or any other thing appertainmg to such land service that then and so often the said master pylotts and seamen and their successirs shall upon and after the receipt of any such warrant perform and execute all and every such thing as shall be comanded and enjoyned unto them or any of them in and by the same; any thing before in thees presents to the contrary hereof notwithstanding And further of our like certain knowledge special grace and meer mocion for us our heirs and successors we grant and confirm unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors the house called the Trinity House with the said appurtenances and all other lands tenements here∣ditaments priviledges perquisites antient dutyes and profitts which the said company mystery brotherhood anti society have heretofore lawfully had and enjoyed or whereof they or any of them or any other to and for their uses have heretofore been lawfully seized and possessed and which the said company mystery brotherhood and society at the time of this our grant do lawfully perceive have hold and enjoy Provided always and our
royal intent and pleasure is that the severall and respective sumes of money hereby granted or mentioned to be granted or confirmed to and for the several and respective uses ends intents and purposes aforesaid are and shall be received and taken in lieu of all other dutyes allowances payments and sumes of money heretofore given granted or received in that behalf And that no further dutyes or sume or sumes of money shall be at any time or times demanded paid or received upon account or for or in respect thereof any thing in these presents contained in any wise notwithstanding And our will and pleasure is that these our letters pasents shall be good and effectuall in the law to all intents respects and purpuses unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their suc∣cessors without sueing out of any writt or writts of ad quod dampnum the statute of mortmaine or any other statute act ordinance proclamacion provision or restraint thereof heretofore had made set forth ordained proved or any thing cause or matter whatsoever to the contrary notwithstanding Although express mencion of the true yearly value or certainty of these presents or of any of them or of any other gifts or grants by us or by any of our progenitors or predecessors heretofore made to the said master pylotts and seamen of the Trinity House of Newcastle upon Tyne aforesaid in these presents is not made or any statute act ordinance provision proclamacion or restriccion heretofore had made ordained enacted or proved or any other matter cause or thing whatsoever to the contrary thereof in any wise notwithstanding In witnesse &c. the 21 day of October in the 16 year of our reigne.
Transcribed from, and examined with the original charter, which is in English, the 3d Feb. 1724, and ex. Nov. 14, 1739. G. G.—The following note is subjoined.

Vide Pryn's Works of Darkness, p. 184. Proposes to fortify Newcastle, and that the corporation of shipmasters do apply towards it the 2d. per chaldron by them charged on coals, which comes to 1300l. per ann.

DIV2.HEAD: APPENDIX, P. 332. TRINITY-HOUSE CHARTER. King James the Second's Charter, July 26, 1687.
DIV2.P:
JAMES the Second by the grace of God King of England Scotland France and Ireland Defender of the Faith &c. To all to whom these presents shall come greeting. Know ye that wee at the humble petition of the company mistery and brotherhood and society of shippmaster pylots and seamen within the town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of the same town of Newcastle upon Tyne as well for the better encreasing and maintenance of our navigation for the benefitt defence and preservation of our realme as also for the better government rule and order of them and every of them and of our especial grace certain knowledge and meer mocion have villed ordained constituted granted and confirmed and by these presents for us our and successors do will ordyen constitute declare grant and confirm that all and singular the sppasters pylots and seamen of the town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne and all the men of the said company mystery bro∣therhood and society dwelling ui inhabiting within the said town of Newcastle upon Tyne
for ever thereafter for the better government rule or order of them and for the profitt comodity and relief of die good and honest men and for the fear and terrour of evil and wicked offenders be and shall be by virtue of these presents one body corpo∣rate and politique in deed and name by the name of Master Pylots and Seamen of the Trinity House of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne We do by these presents for us our heirs and successors really and fully create make ordeyne and constitute declare and confirm one body politique in deed and name and that by the same name they have perpetual succession and that they and their successors by the name of Master Pylots and Seamen of the Trinity House of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne shall be ever hereafter persons able and capable in the law to purchase take receive and enjoy lands tenements rents services and other possessions and hereditaments whatsoever to them and their successors for ever in see or perpetuity or for term of lives years or otherwise in what sort soever and also all manner of goods chattels and things whatsoever of what name nature or quality soever they be and also to give grant alien assign and dispose of mannors messuages lands tenements and hereditaments and also to do and execute all and singular other acts and things whatsoever by the name aforesaid and that by the name of Master Pylots and Seamen of the town of Newcastle upon Tyne in the county of Newcastle upon Tyne they shall and may be able to plead and be impleaded to answer and be answered unto to defend and be defended in whatsoever court and place and before any judge and justices or any other persons or officers of us our heirs and successors whatsoever in all and singular actions pleas suites plaints matters and demands of what kind nature or quality they shall be in the same manner and form as any other our leige subjects of this our realme of England being persons able and capable in law or any other body corporate and politique within this our realm of England can or may have purchase receive possess enjoy retain give grant let alien assign and dispose plead and be impleaded answer and be answered unto defend and be defended do permitt or execute And we do also by these presents constitute and ordain Richard Hutton one of the company mystery bro∣therhood and societie of shipmasters pylots and seamen within the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne from henceforth to be master of the said company mystery brotherhood and society and that Tho. Aubone Edwd Carr Wm. Leack the elder Wm. Hindmarsh Jno. Bee Tho. Richardson Rob' Bullman Tho. Rewcastle Joseph Swaddell John Wilkinson John Vaughan and Tho. Watson now being of the company mistery brotherhood and society of shipmasters pylots and seamen of the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from henceforth be and be called elder brothers of the said company mystery brotherhood and society And that Roger Heaton Leonard Vaughan Henry Mitforth George Leamon John Parker John Morton Anthony Hodgshon John Wilson Edmund Oxley John Dunne Tho. Blakeston Robert Jackson Tho. Shafio Geo. Storey Geo. Clarke John Eden Mich. Ballasar Edwd Robinson Tho. Coming Robert Moody Geo. Wilkinson John Chilton and all other the company mystery brotherhood and society of shipmasters pylots and seamen within the said town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from henceforth be and be called younger brothers of the said company mystery brotherhood and society and that two of the said elder brother (that is to say) Wm. Leack the elder and Thomas Rewcastle shall from henceforth be and be called elder wardens of the said company mystery brotherhood and society; and that two of the said elder brothers (that is to say) Thomas Richardson John Vaughan shall from henceforth be and be called assistants unto the said elder wardens and that two of the said younger brethren (that is to say) Roger Heaton and Leonard Vaughan shall from henceforth be and be called younger wardens of the said company mystery brotherhood and society and that two other of the said younger brothers (that is to
say) Henry Mitforth and George Leamon shall from henceforth be and be called as∣sistants to the said younger wardens All which persons nominated placed and appointed in their several offices places and functions shall so continue in their said offices places and functions untill from thence they shall be severally removed expelled or discharged and others of the said company mystery brotherhood and society in their severall roomes and places shall be elected and chosen in manner as in these presents shall be hereafter expressed And we do further for the consideracion aforesaid and of our certain know∣ledge meer motion and special grace for us our heirs and successors grant and confirm unto the said master pylots and seamen and their successors that it shall be lawfull for them and their successors yearly and from time to time at their pleasures and as often as it shall seem unto them or the most part of them to be expedient to assemble and meet together at a certain house called the Trinity House scituate and lyeing in the said town and county of Newcastle upon Tyne and then and there by their general consent or most voices of the said whole company mystery brotherhood and society as well of elder brothers as younger brothers then and there being present to elect and choose twelve persons of the said whole company mystery brotherhood and society as well of the elder brothers as of younger brothers then and there being present to elect and choose twelve persons of the said whole company mystery brotherhood and society as well of elder brothers as younger brothers whereof six at least to be of the elder brothers if they be then and there present, and in supply of such elder brothers wanting then the residue to be taken out of the younger brothers then and there present Which twelve persons so by them elected and chosen shall for that time have full and absolute power and authority from their several offices functions and places not only to remove expel and discharge the said master elder wardens and younger wardens or any of them herein ap∣pointed or hereafter in manner and form following to be nominated elected or ap∣pointed and likewise the said assistants as well unto the said elder wardens as younger wardens herein appointed or hereafter in manner and form following to be nominated elected and appointed or any of the said elder wardens or younger wardens or as∣sistants unto the said elder wardens or younger wardens herein appointed or here∣after in manner and form following to be nominated elected and appointed but also in their names places and steads or in the names places and steads of them or any of them so removed expelled put out or otherwise discharged to nominare elect and substitute the same person or persons so removed put forth or discharged or any other person or persons of the said company mystery brotherhood and society in manner and form following (that is to say) out of the said whole company mystery brotherhood and society of the said cider brothers hereby constituted and ordained or by the said company mystery brotherhood and society at any times or times hereafter to be elected nominated or appointed one master two elder wardens and two assistants unto the said elder wardens and out of the said company of younger brothers two younger wardens and two assistants unto the said younger wardens And it shall be lawful for the said master wardens and assissants so newly elected and the aforesaid twelve persons being elected as aforesaid or the most part of them then and there present to elect nominate constitute and appoint such other officer or officers servant or servants for and concerning the necessary expedition of the business and other occasions of the said company mystery brotherhood and society as shall be expedient serviceable and convenient for the same and likewise to admit into the said company mystery brotherhood and society such other shipmasters pylots and seamen being free burgesses of the said town of Newcastle upon Tyne from time to time and as often as it shall seem expedient unto them And also we do grant for us our heirs and successors unto the said master pylots and seamen and their successors that they the said master pylots and seamen and that successors may make or cause to be made fo themselves one common seal for the expedicion of their business causes and aairs that may be appertain and belong to the said company mystery brotherhood and
society and the same seal at any time or times to alter and change at their wills; and pleasures And we do further of our certain knowledge meer mocion and special grace grant for us our heirs and successors unto the said master pylots and seamen and their successors for ever that the said master pilots and seamen and their successors from time to time and as often as shall be expedient rnay meet and assemble together at the said Trinitv House to conserr treat commune agree and conclude among themselves of for and concerning the conservation good estate and good government of the said company mystery brotherhood and society and for reporting or ending of such matters and controversies as shall be lawfully and by aurhority referred or submitted to them touching any person or persons in marine and sea causes only, touching the cunning knowledge or science or seamen that shall happen from time to time to resort to the river of Tyne the creeks or members of the same (that is to say) Blyth Sun∣derland Hartlepoole Whitby and Steaths and all other creeks and members be∣longing to the said port of Newcastle upon Tyne And further we will and grant for us our heirs and successors that they the said master pilots and seamen or the greatest number of them do lawfully meet and assemble together in the said Trinity House whereof the said master one ot the elder wardens one of the younger wardens or in the absence of such wardens one of the elder assistants or one of the younger assistants respectively shall be three shall have full power and authority from time to time to constitute establish and make decrees laws constitutions and ordinances for the good estate conservation and wholesom government to be had amongst themselves and for the good direction and encouragement of such seamen and marriners as shall resort from time to time to the said port and town of Newcastle creeks and members aforesaid so belonging to the said port and town of Newcastle touching marine and sea causes only And further we do grant for us our heirs and successors unto the said master pilots and seamen and their successors full power and authority that whatsoever shall be reasonably and lawfully concluded and agreed upon at any such lawfull assembly or meeting of the said master pylots and seamen touching the causes aforesaid the same shall be kept and observed by and amongst the said company mistery brotherhood and society and all others whom the same shall concern and whosoever of the said company mystery brotherhood or sociery shall offend against the said decrees orders laws and ordinances or any of them it shall be lawfull unto the said master pylots and seamen or the greatest number of them so lawfully assembled together whereof the master for the time being one of the elder wardens one of the younger wardens or in the absence of the said wardens one of the elder assistants or one of the younger assistants respectively shall be three at their discretions in reason and equity having consideration unto the quality and quantity of the faules to punish and correct by pains penalties and amercement to be reasonably inflicted upon such offenders and the said pains pe∣nalties and amercements so inflicted and imposed to levy take and conveit to the use of the said company mystery brotherhood and society And that likewise it shall be lawful for the said master pilots and seamen from time to time as often as they shall think meet and convenient to revoke ia supply alter or change any article or articles decrees orders laws and ordinaces so by them lawfully made or hereafter to be made, so always as the said decrees orders laws costitutions ordinances pa penalties and amercements be reasonable and not repugnant nor contrary to the laws statutes cus∣toms and rights of this our realm of England nor the liberties franchises priviledges cus∣toms prescriptions characters or grants of the said town of Newcastle And we do our like special grace certain knowledge and meer motion grant for us our heirs as suc∣cessors unto the said master pilots and seamen and their successors fro ever that it shall used may be lawful for them or for the said master or one of the said elder wardens and of the said younger wardens or for want of such they being absent then for any three of
the most antient of the said company mystery brotherhood and society being present at home and their successors only from time to time to nominateand appoint sufficient and skillfull pylot or pylots for the bringing up and carrying down the river of Tyne and in and out of all or any other the creeks and members before named belonging to the town and port of Newcastle upon Tyne all ships or vessells where the owner or part owner master or purser shall be desirous or willing to have a pylot for conducting such ships or vessels up or down the said river of Tyne or in or out of any of the creeks or members of the same unless such owner part owner master or purser shall make special or other choice of any other of the said company mystery brotherhood and society then present at home and that such pylot or pylots so to be nominated and appointed or specially chosen as afore∣said shall att all time and times within the said river of Tyne and in and out all and every the creeks and members belonging to the said port have the pylottship conducting bringing up and carrying down and in and out of all such ships and vessels as aforesaid and that no other person or persons whatsoever shall deal or intermeddle therein And for as much as in ports beyond the seas all manner of merchant strangers resorting thither are compelled to take pylots belonging to the same respective ports or otherwise to pay the duty of pylotage there usually paid and accustomed our will and pleasure is and we do hereby for us our heirs and successors declare ordain and grant that all masters or owners of any strangers ships which shall at any time or times hereafter resort or come into our said port of Newcastle upon Tyne or any the creeks or members of the same shall take in and receive on board the same pylotts to be for that purpose nominated and authorised by the said master or one of the said elder wardens and one of the said younger wardens or for want of them they being absent then by any three of the most antient of the said company mystery brotherhood and society being present as is aforesaid from time to time (they takeing care to have always in readinessa sufficient number of able and skillfull men to that purpose) for the bringing up and carrying down the river of Tyne and in and out of all or any other the creeks and members before named belonging to the said town and port all such strangers ships and vessels as aforesaid And if such strangers or any of them shall refuse denie or neglect to take on board their said ships or vessels the said pylotts so to be appointed as aforesaid they shall nevertheless answer and pay to the said master pylotts and seamen of the said Trinity House and their successors from time to time the seve∣ral duties for pylotage herein after mentioned as if they had taken in such pylotts and the said master pylotts and seamen of the said Trinity House of Newcastle upon Tyne and their successors shall and may ask demand and receive the same from time to time and also shall and may use all lawful ways and means requisite for the levying and recovering of the said duties and sums of money any law usage custom prescription or other thing to the contrary notwithstanding And whereas by the frequent and dangerous incursions of the sea upon the port of Newcastle the society are put to necessary and extraordinary charges for prevention and repair of the ruines thereby daily growing we are willing for their better assistance therein that for the future they may receive some reasonable pay∣ments and allowances in that behalf Our will and pleasure theretore is and we do hereby for us our heirs and successors declare and grant unto the said master pylots and seamen and their successors that it shall and may be lawfull to and for the said master pylotts and seamen and for such of them as shall be so appointed nominated or chosen as aforesaid and for their ministers and officers minister or officer in this behalf so to be employed to demand receive perceive and take of the owner part owner master purser or factor of every ship or vessell so by them or any of them to be conducted as aforesaid being loaden for every foot which such ships or vessells so by them to be conducted and loaden shall draw twelve pence of lawfull money of England as hath been usually received and taken by the said company and also the sum of six pence more of like money of all strangers and aliens only over and besides the said twelve pence in this behalf formerly paid and for
every foot which such ships or vessells which shall be light being so conducted shall draw eight pence as formerly the said company have usually taken and also the sum of four pence more of like money of aliens or strangers only over and besides the said eight pence in this behalf formerly received And furthermore of our like abundant grace certain knowledge and meer motion we for us our heirs and successors have given granted and confirmed and by these presents do give grant and confirm unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors that all person and persons as well subjects as strangers born being owner or owners of any goods wares comodities or merchandizes which shall at any time or times hereafter be brought in any ship or vessel from beyond the seas into the said river of Tyne or the creeks or members aforesaid or any creek or member be∣longing to the said port of Newcastle upon Tyne shall from time to time and as often as such goods wares comodities or merchandizes shall be so brought in pay or cause to be paid to the said master pilotts and seamen and their successors or their officers or ministers in that behalf appointed for the time being an ancient duty heretofore lawfully accus∣tomably and usually paid to the said company mystery brotherhood and society called primagcPrimage is still paid to this society at two-pence preton. Lastage is three-pence per last. Buoyage, all under twenty ton burthen pay four-pence, &c. Laghtage, six-pence for an English vessel. (ee Charity.) (that is to say) two pence of every tunn of wine oyle and all other goods wares merchandizes and comodities rated and accounted by the tunn (fish killed and brought in by the Englishmen only excepted) and three pence for every last of flax hemp pitch tarr or any other goods raff wares merchandizes and comodities whatsoever rated and accounted by the last in manner and form following (that is to say) aliens and strangers born and all other such person or persons which with their said ships or vessells shall arrive within the said port or in any of the said creeks or members and not belonging to the same, before they depart with their ships or vessells from the said ports or forth of the said creeks shall pay the dutyes aforesaid for and in the name of primage as is aforesaid and every free merchant and other inhabitant of Newcastle aforesaid arriving with theirsaid ships or vessells within the said river of Tyne shall pay the dutyes aforesaid within ten days after the landing of the said goods as aforesaid upon lawfull demand by the said master pylotts and seamen or their officers or ministers by them to be appointed which said duty called primage and whatsoever sum or sums hereafter shall so accrue unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors or otherwise shall arise and happen unto them by fines forfeitures and amerciaments among themselves or otherwise howsoever shall be to the only use comodity and profitt of the said master pylots and seamen and their successors for the repairing of the said house or hall called Trinity House and for the finding of twelve poor persons of the said company mistery brotherhood and society or their wives which are or shall hereafter fall into poverty and also for reliefe and succor of other poor marmers and seamen haveing suffered shipwrack or otherwise distressed and such as by them and their suc∣essors shall be thought meet and necessary therewith to be relieved according to the charity as they have formerly used without any account or any thing therefore to us our heirs and successors to be yielded paid and done and without any lawful mostestation or trouble of any other person or persons whatsoever for and concerning the same And furthermore we of our like special grace certain knowledge and meer motion have given and granted and by these presents do for us our heirs and successors give and grant unto the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors that they by their officers or ministers to be appointed as aforesaid from time to time for ever shall and may from henceforth levy have receive collect and take for and towards the charges of repairing and orderly removeing and keeping of those two houses called the Light∣houses att the North Sheilds heretofore builded kept and maintained by the said company
mistery brotherhood and society for marks for the entring of the said haven of Tin∣mouth and for lights to be kept in them for the night time from quarter and half quarter flood or half ebb the several duties following (that is to say) of every Englishship or other vessell entring within the said haven or any the creeks or members of the same whereof an Englishman born shall be owner eight pence current English money for every time that any such ship or vessell shall enter or come within the said haven or any of the said creeks or members of the same And also to take of every ship or vessell whereof any stranger not born within this realm is or shall be owner sixteen pence of every such ship or vessell for every time so entring the said haven or any of the creeks or members of the same towards the maintenance of the marks or lights aforesaid And further of our like abundant grace cercain knowledge and meer motion we for us our heirs and suc∣cessors do constitute and appoint the said master pylotts and seamen their sucessors and assigns that they by themselves or their sufficient officers or ministers in that behalf to be appointed for the better and more safe conducting of vessells going up and coming down the said river of Tyne and coming in or going forth of any of the creeks or mem∣bers thereof as aforesaid shall from henceforth at all time and times hereafter have as formerly they have accustomably had the appointing setting limitting bouying canning marking and beaconing of the river of Tyne and renewing repairing and removing of the same as occasion shall require and that the said master pylotts and seamen and their successors and assigns for and towards the charges of the same from time to time hereafter shall have perceive collect and take of every shipor vessell whereof an English∣man born is or shall be owner being in burthen above twenty chalders of coles and coming into the said river of Tyne or any of the said creeks or members six pence of lawfull money of England and of every ship or vessell being under twenty chalders of coles whereof an Englishman born is or shall be owner and coming into the said river of Tyne or any of the said creeks or members four pence of like lawfull money of England and of every ship or vessell entring into the said haven or any of the creeks or members aforesaid whereof any alien born is or shall be owner eight pence of like lawfull money of England And for as much as the said master pylotts anti seamen being oftentimes in themselves their servants and ships to be charged and employed at one hour's warning in onr service art sea in and for the good and necessary detence of our realms and kingdoms cannot give their due attendance therein with such diligence as their duty was and is to do by reason that they be many times compelled to bear arms or to contribute unto the charge thereof for land service as also to serve upon iuquests and juries att assizes sessions court leets court barons before the coroner and in other courts comissions and places of jurisdiction to the great vexation and burthen of the said corporacion and to t!ie peril of the said service att sea by reason they cannot conveniently attend both one and the other Therefore we of our abundant grace certain knowledge and meer motion do will and grant by these presents for us our heirs and successors that they and every of them and all and every other brother and minister of the same being mariners and sea∣saring men and their and every of their servants and apprenuces that now be or at any time or times hereafter shall be their successors and the succesors of every of them from time to time and all times from henceforth shall be discharged and exempted from the bearing or finding of any armour to or for any land service at opon a generall muster or other view to be taken of atmour in any of the counties or places where they or any of them shall make their aboad or dwelling att the time of the said musters or view taken and from being or contributing to the setting forth of any soldiers to be im∣ployed or sent forth to or for land service other than as mariners and seamen in sea service As also that they and every of them shall be in like manner discharged and exempted from being sumoned and put in assize juries inquests and inquisitions attaints and other recognizances taken or sumoned within the said counties or places or
any of them unless that they the said master pylotts and seamen and other seamen and mariners aforesaid be compelled thereunto or compellable by reason of his or their tenures or unless ie be for our service att every admiralty sessions which they and every of them shall be always tied and bound to attend upon their perils being thereunto lawfully sumoned as heretofore and moreover that they and every of them shall be likewise exempted and discharged from being otherwise taxed to for or with any manner of land service whatsoever (other then as aforesaid) or to be contributary to the same And that if att any time or times hereafter the said master pylotts and seamen or any of them or any other brother officer minister or member of the said corporacion for the time being by any ways or
